characters: TIGHT ON A BOWL OF SOUP
DOORS SHUT. SUBWAY STARTS AGAIN., (TIME LAPSE)
CATE AND DEBBIE IN THE VENT
ACROSS THE STREET. EDGE OF THE PARK
SERIES OF SHOTS. MOS, (LONG LENS - FAR AWAY)
FINALLY ONLY DEBBIE AND CATE REMAIN
BACK AT THE HEIST., (OUTSIDE THE KITCHEN)
TAMMY. NOW BEING LED DOWN A HALL
MACRO IMAGE OF A FLAWLESS DIAMOND
CASINO QUEEN RIVERBOAT AND RESORT. ST LOUIS, MO.
DEBBIE AND CATE. FROM ACROSS THE STREET

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Deb... Debbie keeps walking. He cruises up next to her.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’re you going?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (without looking back) I have $35 Linus, I can go wherever I want.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: I‘1l give you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (slows/turns) He left you his car?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: No. Well -- he knew I loved it...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That’s not the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: (seriously/intoned) He would have wanted me to drive it. She rolls her eyes. Hot day. Long way to walk. Deb slows. So does Linus. He REVS the car in neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t do that, ok.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Sure. She crosses to the passenger’s side and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: When’s the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow at noon.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Really nice place... (off her look) Queens. Linus changes lanes. Starts moving over toward the right.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: We thought -- it might be a good idea to see your folks.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Who thought?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: You know...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Eleven of you?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Ten. Rusty’s in England. Debbie reaches out and JERKS THE WHEEL crossing two lanes traffic. They head toward New York.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is -- dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: They're not gonna like that.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Anything else “they” want?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact... He doesn’t finish. Knows he spilled too much. Deb turns. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Saul wants to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Linus.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: He left you a note.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Danny did? DEBBIE (CONT’D) Let me see it.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Well that’s just it. In the confusion with him “passing,” and clearing out the “effects” cause we're the ones who have to deal with the “effects...”

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where’s the note?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: We're not sure.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You lost it?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: It‘ll turn up.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You lost my dead brother’s note to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it said. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It said he doesn’t want you to do it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: The job.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You know about that?

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: Well not exactly. But the way he was talking, it sounded pretty clear...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS
dialogues.text: He was worried about you Deb. He doesn’t want you to go back to -- you know... They have come to a stop on the George Washington Bridge all at once, Deb FLINGS OPEN THE DOOR. She steps out into bumper to bumper traffic heading toward Manhattan, leavin Linus stuck in the car.

dialogues.speaker: LINUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Deb. Wait. Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeming city life. Blur and shocks of colors. Saul Leiter come to life in a modern context. INT. BERGDORF’S - DAY Debbie peruses, approaches the cosmetics counter. The salesperson is consumed with a COSTUMER. Debbie subtly gr a few bottles of face cream and continues looking, develo an air of impatience. Once the salesperson finishes --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me -- I’d like to return these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Do you have your receipt?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (demonstrating) No but they’re unopened, haven’t been touched --

dialogues.speaker: SALESPERSON
dialogues.text: I can’t accept a return without a receipt --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: They’re sealed, brand new --

dialogues.speaker: SALESPERSON
dialogues.text: I understand but we have a strict return policy and cannot accept --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. I bought them a week ago.

dialogues.speaker: SALESPERSON
dialogues.text: Ma’am -- I need a receipt.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll keep them. Jesus. Can I at least get a bag to carry it all? As the salesperson hands her a bag with a curt smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie approaches with a Bergdorf’s bag full of products Bubble bath, face cream, lotion -- wearing an obviously stolen pair of sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A buzz around the reception desk. A clerk is checking out couple in their early forties. They have rolling luggage computer cases.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL GUEST
dialogues.text: We're checking out of room 2814. Jeffery Crandall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around the corner at reception desk, Debbie lurks pretend to read a brochure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, Mr. Crandall. We hope you had a pleasant stay.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL GUEST
dialogues.text: Terrific.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: My name is Monica. If there’s anything else I can do or arrange transportation...

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL GUEST
dialogues.text: I think we're all set.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: (handing him the receipt) Thank you for staying with us. Debbie glances up as...

dialogues.speaker: THE COUPLE
dialogues.text: Wheels their luggage toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crandall’s climb into an Uber headed toward JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie lounges back in a large overstuffed chair.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Hi, this is Mrs. Crandall, we just checked out of 2814. Can I speak to Monica, please? (beat) Oh, hi Monica -- thanks so much. Something has come up and we’re going to need the room another night. (a beat) Oh, bless you. We’re just going to grab quick bite. Could you get the maid in there now? (beat) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens. Debbie steps out, spots the maid cart. Bingo. She heads off toward 2814.  INT. HOTEL ROOM - PLAZA —- CONTINUOUS The MAID fixes pillows. She looks up as Debbie enters.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry. Can you just finish this later? I’ve just got to get off my feet.

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: Of course. Sorry. She gathers the rest of her things and hurries toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Wait. She crosses to the maids cart and grabs a handful of chocolates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie luxuriates in a bath with all of New York out a hu picture window beside her. The lights glisten. The planes glide by. She sinks a little lower in the warm water. Closes her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: INT. TRENDY CLUB. NIGHT
dialogues.text: CATE late 30’s, dressed in all black at a landing, hoveri above her club. It’s packed with kids and sweat. She glances over at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: A FEMALE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Is pouring Grey Goose into a tumbler. She catches Cate’s who shakes her head. The woman, chastised, replaces the G Goose and grabs a bottle of well vodka...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: She scans the floor: hormones and sweat. In the far corne Lebron James is towering above the throng, dancing. Cate descends the stairs and crosses to one of her “Bottle Gir

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Did you get him yet?

dialogues.speaker: BOTTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: No. I will. Cate looks at her with judgement: "C’mon.” The girl grabs her cell phone hurries across the floor. CATE wanders toward the back of the club and spots a gir smoking in the doorway to the alley. She crosses to her a the girl immediately drops her cigarette, grinding it out the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: On a break?

dialogues.speaker: SMOKER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: How’s the line?

dialogues.speaker: SMOKER
dialogues.text: It’s pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Is it down the block?

dialogues.speaker: SMOKER
dialogues.text: (busted) Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You know I need a long line right?

dialogues.speaker: SMOKER
dialogues.text: Sorry. I just got cold.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Here. Take this. She removes her scarf, wraps it around the girl’s neck th smiles. It’s a “get-the fuck-out-there smile,” but still smile.

dialogues.speaker: SMOKER
dialogues.text: Thanks. ACROSS THE CLUB... Lebron is seriously into the music when the Bottle Girl c up and tries to take a selfie. (The height differential i problematic.) He squats lower and extends the camera... CATE... Watching it.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (to her bouncer) Make sure she pushes that out now.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: Hashtag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bout our address. AND SHE IS MOVING AGAIN, this time toward the VIP area wh a YOUNG MAN is holding court with three women and a bottl Dom. Heavily tatted and well toned. Cate glares -- he loo up...

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: (beat) They said I could.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: The guy at the door.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Instead of buying-off my doorman why don’t you pay your bill from last time?

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: (scared) Ok.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Ok. She turns to leave and gets a text. Cate glances down whi she walks.

dialogues.speaker: FROM JLBRD
dialogues.text: “Where is the fkng cemetery? 12 O'clock?” SHE smiles walking away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie wakes up to see Manhattan doing the same out her window. Dawn breaks over the skyline as she rises, stretches, and takes in the view -- her first good night' sleep in four years.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: BERGDORF’S She enters the same revolving doors as she did yesterday, disappearing for a beat...

dialogues.speaker: AND SHE EXITS, (TIME CUT)
dialogues.text: Now dressed in a tasteful black suit with sensible shoes.

dialogues.speaker: A CEMETERY
dialogues.text: Gravestones compressed in a long lens and stretching to t horizon. A massive 747 lands in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black SUV’s roll through the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is there. BASHER, Linus, SAUL, The MALLOY BROTHE even YEN.

dialogues.speaker: THE COFFIN IS WHITE TOO
dialogues.text: With gold handles. A lovely touch of Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PULPIT
dialogues.text: REUBEN (Elliott Gould) is eulogizing:

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN
dialogues.text: Danny Ocean lived a rich full life. By any measure, he was a success. There is more rustling and a few eye rolls. Reuben continues.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whether in business, not all of which we can discuss today... A few sighs of relief.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or as a loving son, to Dennis and Darlene. Everyone turns to acknowledge DENNIS OCEAN, seated on the left.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Stares straight ahead. Doesn’t glance at her father.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or as a brother. She looks up. Shakes her head: don’t you dare.  11.

dialogues.speaker: REUBEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (stumbles) Who -- had a sister. As -- brothers do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are milling around outside the chapel. Debbie approaches Saul (Carl Reiner.)

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hello, Saul.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Sweetie. Oh my gosh. (kisses) You look great.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Well -- you made it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Listen to me for a minute...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: It killed him, Debbie. This life -- it killed him.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He had a genetic valve disorder.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Well it didn’t help. And it’s no good for you either. Please don’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Whatever it is he wouldn’t tell us you were gonna do. Debbie smiles -- doesn’t respond. She leans over and kiss Saul on the cheek.  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot day. Birds. She takes off her jacket. Funny how a graveyard can feel like the country. Basher (Don Cheadle) comes up beside her.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: ‘ello love.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: No... Not me. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hear it’s good though.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He told you?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Just said it was “somethin’.” An’ that it was pretty amazing.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He said that?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Mmm. He said it was insane and you'd end up back in jail but it was pretty brilliant. Sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You coming back to the house?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Nah. She motions toward the gang. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: Sure. (beat) One question.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: BASHER
dialogues.text: (leans in/a wink) Why’d you tell him, love?  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one question she can’t answer. It lingers with her. H gives her a kiss on the cheek and heads on his way.

dialogues.speaker: CAR HORN
dialogues.text: Two short beeps. Deb turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoked window of a black SUV lowers revealing --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Blonde, stylish, hair perfectly messy. Her car radio fill the graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb climbs in the passengers side as Cate turns down the music. Cate grabs her friend’s face. Big kiss on the chee

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Easy. I’ve been in the slammer.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Really? Hadn’t heard.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Thanks. That was stressful...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Everybody trying to get me to go straight.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Kind of cheeky. They’re crooks too.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No kidding. Cate swings the car onto the expressway. Deb takes off he shoes. Puts her bare feet on the dashboard and rubs them. Deb puts her bare feet on the dashboard. DEBBIE (CONT’D) You get the credit line?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Don’t know what it’s for. (off her look) Please don’t do that?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Do what? Cate imitates her expression. DEBBIE (CONT’D) Oh. That’s my “just spent four- years in jail and my partner lets me down face.”

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m not your partner yet. (cell phone rings) Hello? (beat) I don’t care Jeffrey... No I don’t want to talk to her... (another beat) ‘Cause it’s not her job anymore. It was her job until she got fired, now it’s not her job... (listens) She can write me five letters, she’s not getting her job back. (beat) Because she stole from me Jeffrey and people who steal are not trustworthy. On that, she happens to lock eyes Deb who starts to laugh Cate can’t help it smiles too. Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean “normal” people who steal. Not...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Like professionals?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights switch on, illuminating a huge empty space. gorgeous in its decay. Carved wood and peeling plaster. gold leaf is sporadic.  She flips Deb looks 15.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This is great.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Try heating it. on some more lights.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a room for you upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: New club?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Maybe one day. around. More space than she’s seen in five years.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Did you call Kendall?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: She quit. Moved to Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (surveying the room) What about Paige?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (stops) It would honestly help if I knew what all of this was for.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I know... I know... I’1l1 tell you tomorrow. Deb deposits her bag, crosses to Cate. Gives her a kiss o the cheek. She turns DEBBIE (CONT’D) I’ll see ya later.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You just got here.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I've been inside for five years. I’m going for a walk. and heads up the aisle of the theater...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie walks down a familiar cobblestone street. Though s seems composed, a rage grows within her as she approaches  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie walks into mecca for the downtown art scene. KLAUS GUNTHER makes Gagosian jealous. Sycophants, hipsters and lot of money. And in the center of it all stands Klaus himself: undeniably handsome, just as oily, he wears a wh linen shirt unbuttoned to the jewlery. You should see through this guy but you can’t. Debbie grabs a glass of champagne from a waiter and crosses toward him.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Is talking with a group of young women, when he spots Deb and shifts from charm to restrained terror. He makes quic apologies and starts to leave...

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (frozen) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Patron of the arts.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I have a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Good. She steps really close to him -- an intimate moment -- DEBBIE (CONT’D) Do you know what a shiv is? He feels something sharp against his ribs. Gasps --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Stop it --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I made this one. Proud of it, too. See -- it’s important not to melt the toothbrush too much. That way it keeps its length and the strength. So when you stab, you slice up and around. Debbie drags the shiv up the front of his shirt, towards neck. To a bystander it might look like a flirtatious mov with a large toothpick.  17. DEBBIE (CONT’D) Nice face. Inside you’re what we like to call “a pretty girl” --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I'll call the police -- Deb takes the shiv and slices up the front of his shirt, shredding it. She pops the button on his collar, taking i for a souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Auf Wiedersehen. Debbie strides out, still purposeful, while Klaus looks o terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All fluorescence and backlit pictures of the dishes. Debb stands at the counter -- draws a long breath of General Tso’s. They hand her a white plastic bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark. A few safety lights are on. Deb enters the bac of the theater and crosses to a staircase on the side of stage carrying her take out.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS LOFT SPACE
dialogues.text: It used to be a rehearsal studio. Vast and open with vari bits of living area defined by loose furniture. It’s chic a very hard-to-define-kind-of-way.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: Crosses to the kitchen area, fishes through drawers for a plate and decamps at the small kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out the still-warm white containers and dumps t on her plate. Can’t get to the chopsticks fast enough...

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that all for you?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (turning/mouthful ) Oh, hi. Want some.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No.  18. Cate’s wearing a silk chinese robe. She crosses to the table. Sits.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s late.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Took a walk.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Where? Deb doesn’t answer. They look at each other for a beat an exchange five or six lines of unspoken conversation.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why would you do something like that?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I had to.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No, you didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Closure?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Did he see you?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Debbie takes the shiv out of her purse and shows it to Ca Toothbrush on one end, lethal blade on the other.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Jesus. (beat) Did you “use it?”

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Just a button. She puts Klaus’ button on the table. Cate laughs. They share the moment. Then suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (calls out) Hey, Luis... You gotta go. Cate doesn’t turn as the young man from the club enters w pants but no shirt. Even more muscles. Even more ink.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: I can wait.  19.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: That’s ok. I’11 see you soon.

dialogues.speaker: LUIS
dialogues.text: Seriously.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (turns) Seriously. Go. Luis gets the hints and grabs his shirt, heading downstai

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Does he have to go? Cate laughs. Deb slides over the carton of orange chicken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is waking up from the night before. MEN in ORAN SUITS hang off the back of trucks collecting trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's wide awake. Cate’s “guest room” is a partitioned sp filled with boxes of bootlegged vodka. A certain larcenou charm with a stunning view of the Manhattan Bridge. Deb s up in bed. Stretches (freedom). She stares out the window at the building across the alley -- seems to pause...

dialogues.speaker: FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: ZIRGA (CARL REINER) AND TERRY BENEDICT (ANDY GARCIA) walk casino floor with their respective henchmen behind them. They pass. DANNY... .--who glances up from his chair at the video poker machi THE SHOT CONTINUES TO SUDDENLY INCLUDE... DEBBIE... .--who stands at the progressive slots holding a bucket o Silver dollars (STILL OCEAN’S ELEVEN -- WE JUST HAVEN’T S THIS BEFORE. Deb clocks Benedict as he passes, feeds a dollar token in the slot, and pulls the huge lever. Wheels spin...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (jackpot) OH MY GOD...  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict strides down the hallway with two employees in tow...

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: That’s not supposed to hit ‘til December.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: I understand sir.

dialogues.speaker: BENEDICT
dialogues.text: Did you check the machine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright neon. No frills. Deb sits on a hard plastic chair. Turns... Looks at Benedict...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Where’s my money! Benedict pauses at the door. Takes her in. DEBBIE (CONT’D) I drove here from Bakersfield. SERIES OF SHOTS. OCEAN’S ELEVEN The swat team carries out the money. The van arrives at the airport. The team meets at the Bellagio fountain.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bullshit, Danny!

dialogues.speaker: SHOT. DEB
dialogues.text: She yells into a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: “Pulled a lever”? You think that’s what I did? I “pulled a lever?” (beat) Yeah, and if I hadn’t you would have had Terry Benedict up your ass. I bought you time Danny. I deserve the same share as everybody else... (beat) No! Don’t you dare hang... (beat/quieter) ...up. Asshole.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a massive landscape. People stroll. Boats sail. Kite fly. It would take a moment to pick out the two women heading toward the camera.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Honestly when I tell you, it’s going to sound a little...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Crazy?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Maybe. But there aren’t any holes. I’ve gone through it a million times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stroll toward the camera in the dappled sunlight. As they leave the narrow path, Central Park opens in front o them. Fifth Avenue looms. Deb stops -- turns toward Cate.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: What? Deb motions in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trees? Deb points to...

dialogues.speaker: THE MET
dialogues.text: Rising up above the treeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cocks her head slightly, takes in the museum. Then sh reaches for Deb’s hand and walks her slowly over to a par bench. They sit together.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (deep breath/softly) Look -- I have a friend with a house on Fire Island. He’s in Europe for a few months and the place is just sitting empty. You could go out there and stare at the water and just...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This works, Cate.  22.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It really works.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (pause) That’s a museum, Debbie. And they care about the things inside it. That’s what makes it a museum.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We're not robbing the museum. Pause... DEBBIE (CONT’D) We're robbing someone in the museum. The museum is just the decoy. She looks back at it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mingle with tourists ambling by the Whistlers and Winslow Homers. John Singer Sargent’s ‘Madam X’ looks dow as they walk by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand in front of a sign next to the ticket booths. sign reads: “CLOSED THE FIRST MONDAY IN MAY.”

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: First Monday in May?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Shh.

dialogues.speaker: . MET BALL
dialogues.text: Years of haute couture on display. The richest models in world wear the most expensive and glamorous fashion. They glide in slow motion past a million strobes as Debbie explains:

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE OCEAN, (0.S)
dialogues.text: It’s the biggest event of the year. Hundreds of the richest people gathered under one roof...  23.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: A HALAL CART
dialogues.text: They eat a falafel. Deb gestures. Cate nods.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS. MOS, (LONG LENS - FAR AWAY)
dialogues.text: Through the bustle and traffic of New York, Deb explains job’. In subways... Taxi’s... Restaurants... With diagrams, gestures, and models made of salt shakers and s cubes. Slowly, through it all, Cate’s body language subtl changes. She begins, literally, to lean in until...

dialogues.speaker: MET CAFE
dialogues.text: They sit at a table caffeinating in the large open atrium

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Wow as in yes?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: As in: I get it. It’s kind of brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I had some time on my hands.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: It’s dangerous...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No doubt. But that’s not why I like it. This works.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (weighs it) You know I don’t owe you anything.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Just help me figure it out. Then see how you feel. If you don’t like it, you don’t have to do it. You have an off ramp. There is an irritating, irresistible quality that makes h Debbie Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: So what’s first?  24.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We need a designer.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CATE’S LOFT They sit in front of the big screen with the documentary playing. They review a large portfolio book of various designers, their work enshrined in plastic.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: So I thought about Galliano, but I don’t think Anna’s gonna let him dress anybody.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: There’s Largerfeld but it’s kind of Dr. Strangelove. Not sure it’s the right fit. But here, look at this... She spins the book. Hovers over it...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Rose Weil? (beat) I know that name.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Huge in the 90’s. New Romantic stuff. Edwardian collars. But... (flips a page) Hasn’t gone so well lately. She owes the IRS 5 million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Woah.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: It’s bad. A lien on her assets. Impounded her passport. The bank seized her townhouse.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: She sounds perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name “ROSE WEIL” emblazoned on a wall.  25. After a minute ROSE WEIL, 40’s, flustered, lurches toward trash can, vomiting pre-show.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The show was meant to save her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazonian women appear in outfits that suggest a labored attempt at a Victorian theme -- high buttons, lace bodice

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If the new line doesn’t take off, she could even be prosecuted. There is a distracting murmur -- this is not going well. Amongst the unimpressed celebrities, a worried group of middle-aged, Mid-Western Men sit in the front row.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Got a credit line from an Omaha Bank. The only ones who would still loan her money... They literally are soaked in sweat -- stare perplexed at runway at...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Tough way to get into fashion.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAST MODEL
dialogues.text: Strides out in a corset with over abundance metal buckles BDSM meets Pirates of the Caribbean. She turns to the top of the runway to introduce Rose, but one appears. Finally, one of the models drags her on-stag to take a bow before a half-empty tent. INT. BACKSTAGE —- FASHION SHOW - LATER The silent break-down of a failed show: Naked models down champagne, designer detritus covers the floor -- no one scurries to pick it up. Cate wanders through the room, searching for Rose. She pauses at the sound of SOBS coming from the other side of closet door. Cate opens it to find a weeping Rose, sittin on the floor, eating Nutella.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (beat) It was gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (looks up/tear stained) It was shite.  26.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I think that’s a little harsh.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: “Derivative of myself.” That's what they say. Do you know what a hell that is? Resenting who you were because you’ll never be that again -- (shovels Nutella) How did I get here?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (sinks to the floor/gently) You spent 18 million dollars in two years. You had two house boats on the Seine. Cate takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (softly) I know. And they were divine. (a beat) I’m old.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You're not old --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: I’m old and -- (heaves) I’m going to go to prison -- and (heaves) And then I’m going to be poor..

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. Rose looks up. Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if I could make all of this go away. Even get your passport back. Long pause --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: What do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Dress Daphne Kluger for the Met Ball. Rose stares up her.  27.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Are you real?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (means it) You’re an angel. Cate shrugs. She’ll take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAPARAZZI FLASH -- As the glare recedes, a stunning face revealed like a developing photograph -- DAPHNE KLUGER, 3 goofy and aloof and devastatingly charming. She’s been famous for a while and she likes it. Daphne soaks up the flash as the Chairwoman of the Costume Institute introduc her --

dialogues.speaker: CHAIRWOMAN
dialogues.text: The Met Ball is all about grace and elegance and refinement -- so everyone can understand why we chose Ms. Kluger to host it. The crowd erupts in laughter, heads thrown back and shoul rising like a ballet of bobble-heads. Except for Cate and Debbie, seated in the back row, straight-faced. A REPORTE raises his hand --

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Do you know who you’re wearing?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Right now? (she looks under her shirt) Under Armour?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: No, who is dressing you?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I normally do it myself unless I’m really wasted.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: The designer --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Don’t you guys have something better to worry about -- like climate change? (they’re not budging) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise the moment we decide on a designer you'll be the first to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Cate exchange a look. INT. CATE’S LOFT - DEBBIE, CATE, AND ROSE WEIL They leaf through pictures of Daphne Kluger.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Oh. She’s sort of divine. Lovely bust.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Maybe something simple. Just velvet with no other...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Maybe this. 28. She tosses an embossed photo on the table. Rose leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over a fifty diamonds. Even the photo glistens.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Oh my.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It’s called the Harrington necklace. Originally commissioned for an American oil magnate. Weighs over six pounds.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Texans.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: When he died they sold it back to Tiffany’s who’ve kept it in their vault ever since.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: They never let it out.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Oh. Then how do we...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: They might let it out for her.  29.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This years theme is Starry Night. A million jewels glittering in the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: And if you were to insist... On behalf of Daphne Kluger...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Ooooh... Through all of her haze, Rose begins to get it...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a lovely piece.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: MACRO IMAGE OF A FLAWLESS DIAMOND
dialogues.text: It kicks prisms of light all over the frame -- perfect li rainbows. OVER THIS -- IN HINDI:

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (This isn’t flawless.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMITA (Mindy Kaling) holds a large diamond up to her loup Her mother, elegant, glamorous, dripping in jewels, hover close by as she examines it. Behind them are half a dozen other jewlers at a long work bench -- all Indian as well all family. There are glass jars of candy -- everywhere. AMITA’S MOTHER (It’s a good stone. What’s the matter with you?)

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (I work here -- stop selling me.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie stands at the railing staring out over the water a they head past Ellis Island.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She’s like family. My dad used to fence stuff through the store. The island approaches...  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Hindi:

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (This diamond is a K -- at best.) AMITA’S MOTHER (It's an H -- )

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (You’re out of your mind.) AMITA’S MOTHER (I’m concerned about your vision)

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (This is piss yellow --) AMITA’S MOTHER (Why are you so vulgar. If your father was alive...)

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (Grade it yourself!) AMITA’S MOTHER (This is why you have no husband.) Amita looks up, with the loupe on. AMITA’S POV -- THROUGH THE LOUPE Debbie (highly magnified) stands out the window -- waving signaling for Amita to join her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amita approaches Debbie --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: What’re you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear about your pops.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks... (re: her mother/sotto) Sometimes I wish she’d join him. (beat) Sorry about Danny.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Yeah well... I got something for you. A job.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: I heard that didn’t work out too well.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Happens.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: What? You want to run some stuff through the store?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Little more than that. (beat) How long would it take you to make 8 pieces of jewelry? If the stones are already cut.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Six hours?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What if I told you didn’t have to live with your mother anymore? Amita raises an eyebrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb stands at the rail on her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yeah. She’s all good. But we may have to put her up for a while. Had a fight with her mom. INT. CATE’S LOFT A 23 year old GIRL (huge dreads and lots of tats) sits cr legged in a knoll womb chair with an industrial looking computer on her lap. Cate sits across from her staring as she pounds away at her keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Wow.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: What?  32. The girl doesn't answer but stays focused on her screen. Cate leans forward, paying rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I am never taking the F train again. Debbie comes bounding through the doorway with loads of energy. DEBBIE (CONT’D) (sees the girl) Hi there.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Shh.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: She's “in.”

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: In where?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Is this what you mean? There’s just a lot of vases. Cate leans over and looks at her screen.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s the Egyptian wing.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Shes’s in The Met? Debbie crosses over and looks.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (glancing at Deb) Security cameras.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Here’s some more. Just a lot of pictures...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Kandinsky.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Debbie.  33. She looks up. Squints through the dreads.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Nine Ball.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What’s your real name?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Eight Ball.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We use real names around here.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Can we talk for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: PULLING HER AROUND THE CORNER
dialogues.text: They tuck into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: She’s one of the best hackers in the world.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I’m honored.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: She has other clients. They don’t know her real name either.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: She has other clients? Now?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Did you tell her what her cut was?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: ‘Course. High priced talent. They head around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME
dialogues.text: Nine Ball continues to clack away, rocking back and forth a self-soothing kind of way.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Um, Nine ball? Should I call you Nine?  34.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Or Baller. (beat) You know, your footprint sucks, right?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Your footprint. If you want to steal shit you gotta clean this up. My little sister could hack you.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Oh. Cause we hired a guy who... Nine Ball taps a couple of keystrokes and the lights shut off. She taps them again and they turn back on.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We'll fix that.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Awesome. I gotta jet. She grabs her laptop and leaves the frame. Cate and deb exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know.

dialogues.speaker: JACKPOT, (TEN YEARS EARLIER)
dialogues.text: Bells. Whistles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict strides down the hallway with two employees in tow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright neon. No frills. Deb sits on a hard plastic chair. Turns... Looks at Benedict...  35.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Where’s my money!

dialogues.speaker: SHOT. DEB
dialogues.text: She yells into a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: “Pulled a lever”? You think that’s what I did? I “pulled a lever?” A BLACK JACK TABLE - LATER THAT DAY... Debbie fumes in the “first base” position all the way to right of the dealer. She has a drink and stack of chips i front of her. THE DEALER... Whisks cards across the table and pulls a 9. Debbie stand with an 18. So does everyone else at the table. The deale flips her hole card and shows an 8 to total 17. SLOW MOTION DEBBIE’S HAND In one smooth move she reaches for her drink, and swaps_h stack of 5 red chips for 4 red and one black hundred doll chip underneath. If you blinked you’d miss it.

dialogues.speaker: REGULAR MOTION
dialogues.text: The dealer spreads out her chips and pays her $115, match her three reds and one black. A good hustle.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Looks across the table to see...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Staring at her. She glances away at the eye contact. They don’t know each other yet.

dialogues.speaker: A NEW DEAL
dialogues.text: Debbie gets a 14 and busts. No need to switch chips this time. The dealer busts as well. Debbie looks back across the table at --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Who_does the exact same thing that Debbie did. Reaches fo the drink, switches out a stack of four reds for three re and_a black.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR EYES LOCK
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CAESAR’S PALACE POOL - (VERY HOT) DAY Modeled after the Baths of Caracalla. White columns and short togas. Deb lies on a chaise lounge eyes closed, han clenched around her drink. A shadow crosses over her.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie looks up to see her blocking out the sun. Cate has huge hat. Almost religious. She sits on the chaise next t her.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think we have something in common.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I got there first.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I know. Cate hands her a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want a cut.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Do you know what a Savannah is?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Past-posting at a roulette wheel. Double act. A mechanic and a payout.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (gets it) I’m Debbie. Extends her hand. Cate takes it.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Cate Richmond. I knew your brother.  37.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Who didn’t?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Not like that. We did some work together.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: So did we. Had a little trouble settling.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: So did I.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (takes her in) So we were at that table together by accident?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (maybe ) Of course. Beat. They both laugh. Sure. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: BOTH WOMEN, (IN THE PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Emerging side by side from the subway in QUEENS. There is purpose in their step.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: This girl has the best hands I’ve ever seen. Literally. It’s such a waste.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT. ON AN ORANGE CRATE
dialogues.text: Deft hands shuffle and deal Three Card Monte in a blur. A woman’s hand adorned with nail art and a dozen bracelets the honors. Over this -- a voice of undetermined origin:

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (fast, like an auctioneer) Ok following the queen, following the queen aaaaaaaaaaaand you know what i see? -i see a little silhouett-o of a man bout to lose, bout to lose but will he do the fandango? Probably not cuz THAT’S A 2 OF SPADES THANK U, COME AGAIN.  38.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL CONTSTANCE LUM, (AWKWAFINA)
dialogues.text: She works her magic to a visiting chump and his friend fr Manhattan. Kids gather round to watch the abuse on rebuil BMX bikes. Constance has a yellow hoodie and wears huge shades -- a hybrid between an insect and an aviator.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE AND CATE. FROM ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: They watch the show from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Everyone you sent me was too hot. The turnover on pickpockets is huge.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: She fans a deck. Deals out three new cards.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: How about you sir? What’s your name? Is it Wifi? ‘Cause I feel a connection. Now how about you put that Fossil brand wallet where that weird, misshapen mouth is. Don’t know how to play? Well here’s what we do -- we keep your eyes on the queen. Eyes on the queen, eyes on the queen. (Just like last night) Keep your eyes are on the queen and- - look I'm taking it slow, taking it slooow, taking and our eyes are on the queen, eyes on the queen. But. Oh. Wait. Oh no. But where she at, though? Where that bitch at? Is she gonna be over here on the left,? Is she on the right? Or is she in the center? Is that bitch a liberal-leaning libertarian? He points and she flips the card. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) I don’t know but I do know that THAT’S A 3 OF HEARTS -- so what’s it gonna be? I take cash only honey no no cash only honey, no cash no -- honey don’t mope. Just gimme the dope. Constance snatches his money and quickly slips off his Ro in the process.  39.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We take most major credits -- an we keep em. (sees Debbie and Cate) Oh, look -- two real housewives. As he turns to look at Deb and Cate, Constance reaches ar and lifts his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sweetie that’s it for tonight. I gotta headache. We’1l do it tomorrow. I promise. Kissing noises and she’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We’re amateurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Cate sit across from Constance, housing a sub.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) So -- I'm just slipping one necklace?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You are. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Really? That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: It’s a very nice necklace.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: An’ this is legit? I mean you’re serious -- about my cut and all?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: A hundred percent.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Ok. I’m in and... (reaches into her pocket) ..-in that case, here. She hands Cate back her watch.  40. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) I just love the smell of that Subway bread.

dialogues.speaker: AN IPAD
dialogues.text: With luminous images of precious jewels. A woman’s finger swipes it and more massive rocks appear. Swipes again -- emerald... INT. CATE’S CLUB - NIGHT She stands at the bar in thick black reading glasses, pee down at the iPAD. A cacophony is pounding all around her Cate is extreme focus: stare -- swipe. Stare -- swipe...

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: The guy. Jeff. He has three guys with him.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCER
dialogues.text: But he’s the only one on the list.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Just let ‘em in. And she goes back to her jewlery. Cate swipes as...

dialogues.speaker: A CHILD'S FOOT
dialogues.text: Makes solid contact with a soccer ball.

dialogues.speaker: SLIDING GLASS DOOR
dialogues.text: The shot nails the door, mid pane, leaving a huge mark.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PATIO
dialogues.text: A well maintained woman in her mid forties wears athletic garb and is parked with the Sunday Times on her (new) por furniture.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Derek, please, that is not a goal. That is a plate glass win...  41. And she stops mid sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie’s head hovers above the fence line. She locks eyes with her.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Tam.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Freezes in a paralyzed suburban smile...

dialogues.speaker: KERI
dialogues.text: Mommy, Derek said I couldn’t play anymore because he wants to only have another kind of game that...

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Sweetie -- Mommy has to talk to an old friend now. Tammy gets up slowly and walks the other direction toward garage. She glances back and motions for Debbie to meet h on the other side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. FOUR CAR GARAGE - TAMMY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Like the Container Store and Fed Ex had a love child. A suburban warehouse. Tammy’s “eBay Top Seller” Award hangs prominently on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Are you really screening my calls? Deb moves closer. Tammy inhales sharply. DEBBIE (CONT’D) (re: the garage set-up) This is impressive. Debbie peers behind a slightly ajar door which leads to b light lit storage room full of even hotter items --

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? I thought you were --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I got out. Look at all this. I thought you retired.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I did.  42.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (motioning) I guess you’re just collecting knock-off luggage. (smiles) Not as much as fun as hijacking a truck or smuggling shit ina tugboat...

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: What do you want? Debbie steps closer, an intimate tension growing --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (breathy) Just wanted to reconnect. Tammy swallows. DEBBIE (CONT’D) You're not bored out here, are you Tam?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (tense/physical proximity) I’m happy... Out here. Debbie places a strand of Tammy’s hair behind her ear.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (she gets closer) What about in here? (touches her “heart”) How do you feel inside. (closer) When you lie awake at night. Does he snore?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: No. (Deb breathes in her ear) A little.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I need a fence.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I -- stopped doing that.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (closer still) You can start again. You can do anything you want. (hot breath) You were the best, Tam. The best I've ever... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (closer) ..-worked with. Debbie is close enough to kiss Tammy. DEREK, Tammy’s 4 ye old, opens the door --

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: Mommy --

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (strained, snaps her head) Yes, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: DEREK
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say I love you.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I love you, too -- The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No one else can do what you do.

dialogues.speaker: THREE INCHES BETWEEN THEM
dialogues.text: Eyes locked...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TAMMY’S HOUSE - LATER ANGLE ON -- Tammy, from inside the trunk of her car. She throws a suitcase in.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: It’s just a work trip, honey. Mommy will be back soon. The trunk closes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CATE’S THEATER — An old master switch is thrown, bathing the stage in ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various members of the team wander in to the aging theate taking in the faded glory. They meet and mingle. Orange juice and bagels sit on the edge of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Down here, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: “THE MEETING” Everyone is gathered on stage with folding chairs and loo furniture. Downstage, near the broken footlights, sits a large object covered with a sheet. A projector illuminate the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Thank you all for coming. We'd like to present you with a hypothetical situation. 16.5 million dollars in each of your bank accounts. A little over two weeks from now.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: How hypothetical?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Not very. Unless we screw up. The women make eyes. Nobody moves. Debbie removes the sat sheet covering a perfect 3D replica of the Met.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: In three and a half weeks the Met will be hosting its annual ball to celebrate the new Costume Exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: And we're going to rob it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (nausea) Christ. Within the 3D model is a red carpet, the exhibit and the Temple of Dendur --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: -- Not the ball itself, but a very important set of diamonds that will be “attending” the ball -- The video of the “Harrington” diamond necklace plays on screen. Amita lets out a half-orgasmic sigh --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: On the neck of Daphne Kluger. Split Screen -- a picture of Ms. Kluger appears next to t video of the necklace.  45.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who Rose will be dressing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: But I don’t know Daphne K --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You will.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: With her on board, we can get the necklace out of the vault --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (indicates Nine Ball) -- Infiltrate both Met Security -- A shot of the hundreds of Met Security Domes that Cate an Debbie have been snapping fill the screen --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (nod to Tammy) And the Gala itself --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Considered to be the most exclusive party invitation in the world --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: When Daphne becomes suddenly ill and goes to the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: How do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Ipecac.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Ew.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Constance will do what Constance does -- Constance doffs an imaginary hat.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: The necklace will be delivered to Amita, at a secure location inside the museum --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where she will fashion it into eight distinctive pieces of jewelry.  46.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Making all the gorgeous women in this room even more beautiful as they wear them out into the night -- dispersing in eight different directions, and pulling off one of the biggest jewel heists in history. The team stares at them, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: — EVENING

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Le Cirque.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Are we going to meet Daphne Kluger?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We're going to meet someone who makes Daphne Kluger jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Cate sit across from Rose -- sweating profusel and tearing at bread.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: In a minute we are going to get up and someone you know will sit down.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: I know her?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Not personally. Just be cool, aloof --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Kind, but not too kind.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You're sweating.  47.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: I sweat.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: She has a new engagement ring, take her hand, make physical contact, that’s when we’ll get it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: It? Cate and Debbie rise. Rose continues to sweat. Fans herself. After a beat, the actress PENELOPE STERN sits do

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE STERN
dialogues.text: Hi, wow --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (faint/British) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE STERN
dialogues.text: (takes Rose’s hand) Hi. (a beat) I just have to say -- I think you are so brilliant. Like -- beyond. Honestly, I have always dreamed about getting married in one of your dresses. Is that so crazy?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: No... (glances toward the window/sees Deb and Cate) ...Not as crazy as that rock...

dialogues.speaker: PENELOPE STERN
dialogues.text: My ring?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: May I? Rose takes Penelope’s hand, making sure to maintain the moment of intimacy long enough, as she peers overs Penelo shoulder to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE’S POV -- through a telephoto camera lens -- Debbie Cate take photos through the window. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: PAGE SIX
dialogues.text: Lands on a table with a picture of Rose and Penelope dini over candlelight. The headline is evocative: “Be My Dress Be My Dress, Be My Dress -- Met Gala Courtship.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne Kluger looks at an underling...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Rose Weil? Is she still alive? (fuming nonetheless) So what are we doing about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose and Daphne sit on the long velvet bench in the corne

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Remember -- indifference is the greatest aphrodisiac.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming on such short notice.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Of course. Cate appears on the balcony. She crosses, Rose’s eyes tra her, looking over Daphne’s shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I've always admired you. I have so many of your pieces --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (no) Oh, yeah. Debbie appears at the other end of the balcony. Rose’s ey shift -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Obviously this search hasn’t been easy, and so far everything’s been a little, well, boring -- Rose still looks past Daphne -- Debbie and Cate are now staring at her, pressed up against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie plasters her face against the clear window. Rose stares at them looking past Daphne and it’s starting to p her off. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) -- well you seem different, a little twisted -- like me. Daphne realizes she has completely lost Rose -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) What is going on -- Daphne looks over her shoulder out the window -- Cate and Debbie have disappeared. Rose finally looks at Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry -- what were you saying?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I’m trying to hire you. What, did you forget your Adderall? Jesus -- Daphne downs her whiskey, restores the glass. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) For the Met ball. I want you to dress me. Rose looks off to the balcony, beaming with satisfaction. CATE AND DEBBIE... Sit on the edge of planter, exhausted --

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Illuminated in blue light as she stares into a monitor.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: This is dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others hover around her. Next to them is a 3D printer the size of a large desk. It has tubes and pumps and tank Very industrial.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (a true “fence”) Items “arrive” Deb. No one “gets” them from “anywhere.”  50.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: O-kay...

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Ready. She hits a keystroke and the printer begins to WHINE. A lucite replica of the Statue of Liberty begins to emerge front of them.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Once we get the scan of the necklace, we can print a replica in zirconium.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (watching it grow) Wo! Print me a dude.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Get me a scan.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (to Amita) No problem. Let’s go get her a “scan.” Giggles. She nudges Amita who looks embarrassed but intrigued. They wander off together.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (turning to Deb) Three weeks to go.

dialogues.speaker: DIAMONDS
dialogues.text: Three different STUNNING necklaces sit atop black velvet stands. WIDER. INT. TIFFANY’S - PRIVATE SHOWROOM A very proud, tightly-wound TIFFANY’S EXEC fawns over Ros and Amita, posing as her assitant. Amita has a business s and an iPAD. Rose wears a fashionable pair of Google Glasses.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY EXEC
dialogues.text: We thought you might want to see these first --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: These aren't the Harrington.  51.

dialogues.speaker: TIFFANY EXEC
dialogues.text: I know. It’s just that -- there are certain logistical problems with that particular necklace.

dialogues.speaker: 2ND EXEC
dialogues.text: We wouldn’t even know how to insure it.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Well -- we were very clear on the phone. We’re only interested in the Harrington. TIFFANY’S EXEC That would just have to be a much longer discussion.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (a new confidence) I understand. Ok. Much thanks. We'll be going now. Rose turns toward the door Amita following instilling pan in the eyes of the two executives. TIFFANY’S EXEC Wait.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Stops. Turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open -- the Associate and TWO GUARDS w out into a hallway -- across from them is a classic VAULT door. Rose and Amita wait while they spin the two large wheels.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need a little under five minutes with the necklace to get the scan. The vault door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A LOCK-BOX sitting atop crushed black velvet.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: Wearing Google glasses, adjusts them slightly. She waits anxiously.  52. ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH THE GOOGLE GLASS Rose waits for the glasses to connect -- it reads “IDLE - Attempting to connect.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate stands over the computer -- waiting for the scan to in -- it reads “IDLE” -- but the screen goes blank.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Debbie hits the side of the screen like an old TV. Then s starts shaking the flat-screen.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chill. That’s not gonna help. (cooly) No signal. They must be too far underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk toward the necklace. The titanium case is opene It is truly breathtaking. Rose approaches, touching her glasses as if wiping away tears -- but really trying to s the necklace. ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH THE GOOGLE GLASS She can’t transmit a scan -- “CONNECTION LOST.” Rose turn her head so Amita can glimpse the back of the lens. “CONNECTION LOST”.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: This seems very secure down here -- TIFFANY’S ASSOCITE Five feet of solid concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to figure out what they’re going to do --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: You said you wanted to see it in the light.  53.

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE
dialogues.text: This is light --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (getting it) Oh. No, we need real light. (gaining steam) The red carpet happens while the sun is still out. So -- if you --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: And your boss --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: .».-Right. Your boss. If you want thousands of pictures to be taken of this necklace on the neck of Daphne Kluger and every reporter writing TIFFANY’S in big block letters -- we need to know what it will look like. In sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Real sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Otherwise we’re wasting our time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large windows near the ceiling let in beautiful, cascadin natural light. Armed Guards enter first, carrying the necklace under a covering cloth. Rose and Amita follow. The guards set the necklace down, remove the covering cloth and open the cas Rose and Amita stand over it. Rose adjusts her glasses --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (a beat) Come on... ROSE’S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS As the service bar kicks back in. “SCANNING...” appears a the top of the frame --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crowd the computer as it begins to receive the scan Debbie stands over her --  54.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hell yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSE’S POV -- NECKLACE -- THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS -- 43% Sca Complete --

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE
dialogues.text: How is that light, Ms. Weil? Seen what you need to see? ANGLE ON -- ROSE, standing over the necklace, still, not turning to look at him -- ASSOCIATE (CONT’D) Ms. Weil -- He steps toward Rose, she starts circling the necklace -- ASSOCIATE (CONT’D) Is she okay? ROSE’S POV -- NECKLACE -- THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS -- 79% Sca Complete --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, fine -- this is her process -- sort of like meditation--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate awaits the scan -- 96% complete -- Amita and Debbie hover, Debbie’s head shaking, mumbling, threatening the computer --—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose still stands over the necklace --

dialogues.speaker: ASSOCIATE
dialogues.text: If you’re done, Ms. Weil, we'd like to return this to the vault -- ROSE'S POV - NECKLACE - THROUGH GOOGLE GLASS - 99% Scan Complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “SCAN 100%” flashes on Cate’s computer screen. Debbie looks to Cate -- exhales.  55. INT. TIFFANY’S VAULT Rose looks nauseous, like she is about to faint, steadies herself. Amita escorts her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A celebratory kick-back. The crew drinks wine, Rose smoke joint, trying to relax. Debbie stands near the computer w Cate. She finishes her whiskey, puts it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: All right, let’s do this. C’mere -- They all gather round the printer. Debbie looks to the cr

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ready? Cate clicks “print” on the computer -- They stand over the 3D printer. A perfect glass replica of the necklace is birthed into a three dimensional life before their eyes. It’s massive, almost a foot long, at least five pounds -- astonishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is good and drunk. The crew is gathered round. CONSTANCE FREESTYLES from the front of the stage as her cohorts look up her from the front row. (NOTE: To be play over footage preparing for the heist.) TAMMY. Teases her about her crush on Debbie and running a side hustle fencing. NINE BALL -- who lives in the dark web. Stealin’ shit we don’t even know about... Then ROSE -- Teases her about dressing like a Wizard of 0 witch. Broomstick etc.. AMITA -- her sister. They both have wrist bands. Where we you last night girl... Amita embarrassed. Leaps from the stage landing in front of... DEBBIE AND CATE -- Her bosses. Bobbsey Twins Boss Bitches salutes the two of them. “Can I have the night off?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb lies on a chaise lounge eyes closed. A shadow crosses over her.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb and Cate stand at the roulette wheel as total strange Cate dressed stylishly is parked at the end. Deb is highe upon the wheel enthusiastically betting red and black. De downs a cocktail with flourish then calls out for another

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Dr. Pepper and Jack please. No ice. Even the waitress is incredulous and nods. The croupier spins the ball. Cate puts two chips on a column bet. The ball falls onto a red number... DEBBIE (CONT’D) YES! Rojo! Awesome! Better red than dead... (and then) Woohooo...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: During the commotion past-posts five chips on her column switching out high denominations for low ones. As the croupier goes to pay her, she corrects him.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Actually, those are thousands on the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: A HOTEL BED
dialogues.text: An open suitcase, strewn clothes and twenty dollar bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb watches TV while Cate counts the haul.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Nine thousand and sixty.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (turns) That’s all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ITALY. (OCEAN’S TWELVE) RESTAURANT - ONE YEAR LATER... Having completed the heist, Danny and his team clink glas It’s a party: laughter, congratulations, poker game, champagne.

dialogues.speaker: CASINO QUEEN RIVERBOAT AND RESORT. ST LOUIS, MO.
dialogues.text: Deb and Cate sit in the Paddlewheel Grill near the stern. man in suspenders and arm garters serenades on a banjo.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Did you play with boys when you were little?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Only. (beat) «--You?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Sometimes. He wouldn’t let me most of the time. He’d tell my parents he was watching me and then he’d ditch me.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Let it go, Deb.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Two and a half million dollars. (incredulous) In art.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You said you weren’t gonna read about it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I read about it. (beat) And what are we doing? We’re grinding it out in shitty casino’s every night. We’ve even run out of casinos. Now we’re in riverboats.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: It’s not actually a riverboat.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It floats.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Touché.  58.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We shouldn’t even be here. We should be at Caesars lying in a cabana. (manic) We need something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No. We don’t need something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Ido. I need it.

dialogues.speaker: A JOHN SINGER SARGENT, (THE PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie moves through the art, searching for the right spo she wears a scarf, her hat dipped low, a backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame X -- Debbie stares up at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warhol’s Chairman Mao -- Debbie appraises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington Crossing the Delaware -- She looks at the painting -- nods to Amita who peruses th hall. Amita approaches the GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (unfolding a map) Hi, can you help me with something? I’m a bit lost --

dialogues.speaker: ROOM GUARD
dialogues.text: Of course, ma’am.  59.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m walking in circles. So I came from Egypt -- back there...

dialogues.speaker: ROOM GUARD
dialogues.text: Mesopotamia --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (fancy) Oh, huh -- (re: map) But now we’re in America... Very confusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out her backpack and pulls out what looks like rolled up poster. It shines as if it is made of latex --

dialogues.speaker: ROOM GUARD
dialogues.text: No, that’s French Impressionism --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Oh -- I love French Impressionism! (checks the periphery/flirtatious) Must be amazing being around this art all the time. Suddenly, there’s commotion, a crowd surrounding a painti the Guard doesn't know what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM GUARD
dialogues.text: (To Amita) ‘Scuse me. He runs over. Pushes through the crowd --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A replica of WASHINGTON CROSSING THE DELAWARE has been plastered to the wall -- except all the men in the boat a WOMEN: white, black and Native American. Affixed to the w next to the original -- stunning and surreal.

dialogues.speaker: INSTAGRAM
dialogues.text: #banksy #guerillaart #neareverygreatmanisagreatwoman

dialogues.speaker: TWITTER
dialogues.text: “Banksy Hits the Met twitterpic”  60. “How much you want to bet the new Banksy piece ends up in permanent collection.” “George Washington was a CHICK!?!"”

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is a major security breech.

dialogues.speaker: A HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Debbie, Cate, and Tammy sit on a bed WEARING HEADPHONES. Nine Ball sits perched in a window pointing a laser mic a building across the street: Looks like a gun -- works lik mic.

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over headphones) He did it at the Tate, too.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A red laser dot appears on the window.

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So this is acceptable to you?

dialogues.speaker: CHAD MCCALISTER
dialogues.text: Not acceptable. But it’s not like he stole something. He just added something, right? Now you have a Banksy at the Met. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: When we hired you to overhaul the system you said, and I quote, “the redundancy of this system would render any breach...”

dialogues.speaker: CHAD MCCALLISTER
dialogues.text: I know what it says.

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Is this a breach?

dialogues.speaker: CHAD MCCALLISTER
dialogues.text: Technically.

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Well -- this feels kind of technical. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nothing back...) What are you going to about it?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Yeah, douche bag.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Shh.

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Obviously, we’ll do a full audit of the system and plug any major holes.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Yesss!

dialogues.speaker: MET PRESIDENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: CHAD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We'll start immediately. Hi-fives all around. INT. CATE’ Nine Ball

dialogues.speaker: S THEATER
dialogues.text: has hacked into main security program for the Met. Everyone gathers around her monitor. Nine Ball appear on

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Ok, I’m in. Any changes they make we can see and over-write, but they can see our changes too.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Is that a problem?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
