dialogues.text: Not with what we’re changing. They have so much on their plate, they won't even notice. (to Nine Ball) Show ‘em the gallery. clicks a few times and a huge array of cameras the screen. It’s a grid of eighty images.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Wo.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That’s a gallery. But this is the hallway outside the cafe.  62. She nudges Nine Ball who clicks again. Only two images po up.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See -- they’re watching the art. They don’t care about a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: That’s smart.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: All we need is a blind spot in the hall outside the bathroom. Ten feet should do it. Which is nothing compared to the changes they’re gonna be making. (smiles) And it wasn’t even a real Banksy.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A REAL BANKSY. INT. VOGUE MAGAZINE RECEPTION AREA — DAY

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Vogue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the most famous silhouettes in New York sits at he desk. All at once, Anna’s assistant sticks her head in do

dialogues.speaker: ANNA WINTOUR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: That interview? Gala staff position?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA WINTOUR
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Friend of Harvey's.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA WINTOUR
dialogues.text: Fine. Hire her.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY. NOW BEING LED DOWN A HALL
dialogues.text: ANNA’S ASSISTANT We're really short on desk space right now, so you'll be down here. Tammy glances to her left at a large conference room encl in glass.  63.

dialogues.speaker: GLASS
dialogues.text: There, on the wall, like an object of holy worship is the Ball Seating Chart.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CATE’S THEATER - NIGHT Tammy enters, tired, lugging down the center aisle.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Ok. This party is nuts... Everyone turns as she heads toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding. If Anna thinks your dress is ugly -- you can’t wear it. No shit. She will bar your wardrobe. Can I have a sip of that.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Last year she got in a fight with one of the designers two days before the event -- and no one was allowed to wear his clothes! For real. Black-balled. She takes a swig of the water, opens a bag of chips.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, I haven’t eaten all day. (stuffs some chips) Tables cost a quarter million dollars -- that is, if she decides to let you buy one. Not any $250,000 check is accepted, they literally have to approve your money! Debbie reaches out and wipes a chip crumb from Tammy’s mo Tammy inhales slightly at the touch. Cate looks at Debbie "Stop torturing the poor girl."

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Did you get the seating chart?  64.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Of course. She removes her Google Glasses and dangles them towards Debbie...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER MONITOR. UPSTAIRS LOFT, (REHEARSAL SPACE)
dialogues.text: Nine ball sits back at the controls. The glasses sit ina charging dock as The Seating Chart appears in front in fr of them. It’s hard not to be impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Wo. Like -- Leo, Leo?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: There’s only one Leo, dear.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Elon Musk.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (turns) Really?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: I am such a Musk-a-teer.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (slight giggle) Omigod! Taylor Swift.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (joining in/to Amita) You’re so white.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Guys. Please. Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Table three, four o’clock. It’s the straightest shot to the bathroom without putting her in Siberia.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Anna signs-off on all of her changes by email, so...

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Not a problem. I’ve got her email.  65.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Do you have everyone’s email?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Who do you want?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (points) There’s a blank spot right next to her.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: That’s for her date.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Who’s her date?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (quickly) No idea. Shoots a look at Tammy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pre-party for the chairs of the Gala -- Daphne is alrea seated at her table. Klaus strolls up, glances down at hi place card. Daphne looks up. Smiles. He takes her hand...

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I think they put me next to you.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Lucky me.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Dressed as wait staff watches from a portico. She’s rivet on the introduction.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (kissing her hand) Klaus Gunther -- A hand kiss? Really? Klaus slithers into the chair beside her -- one smooth reptilian move.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: DINNER. LATER. TAMMY’S POV Daphne and Klaus laughing, leaning closer, silhouetted by candlelight. Daphne’s voice cuts through...  66.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: That's dirty...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: “THE SEATING CHART” The blank space next to DAPHNE KLUGER is filled in with t name KLAUS GUNTHER. She has a date now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hovers over Nine Ball staring at the newest version o the seating chart. Klaus Gunther...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate bursts through the double doors at the back of the theater, flinging them open at once. Debbie is smoking ou back and Cate is on her in a fury.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: What the fuck. Really?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (turning) Really what?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You couldn't leave it alone? Klaus Gunther!

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Stop. I’m not a croupier. Ora tourist with a bucket of quarters. Or a hotel manager. Don’t con me. Don’t run a job in a job.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It’s not going to matter.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (re: the others) Shh.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Why do you do this? Why can’t you just do a job? Why does it always need an asterisk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen. 67.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He sent me to jail.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: And he’s gonna do it again.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No, he’s not.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m out. Wo.

dialogues.speaker: CATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean it. You gave me an off ramp. I’m taking it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Cate...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: You're framing him. It’s not enough to make a gajillion dollars, you have to pin it on him too? Where does it end? This is just like last time.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No it’s not. (panicked) Fine. I wont do it. I’11 call it off.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Oh good. Glad we had this talk. I feel all better now.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I mean it. (then...) You’ve never been in there. You don’t know what it’s like.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: And I don’t want to find out.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You won’t. I promise. Deb extends her hand. Leaves it out there for an eternity

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (looking up the block) Who's that?  68. She motions toward a Crown Victoria parked at the curb. A man sits at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Some guy. Cate reaches out and slowly takes her hand. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb and Cate seated in the restaurant of the cheesy casin

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We need something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: No. We don’t need something bigger.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Ido. I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb sits across from Klaus Gunther: bleached smile and sSlicked back hair.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: So what do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: KLAUS’ BED He and Debbie (post coital) lie in his sheets.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: It’s not really a forgery because we’re not copying any known painting. It’s previously undiscovered work.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I can’t sign the provenance because they know me but...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It’s still fraud.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: That’s not clear.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate’s first club. There isn’t much room.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: It’s still fraud.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That’s not clear.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I know Klaus Gunther. I’ve known him for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. He wants you do it too. He can’t front as the owner because they know him.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m sure they do.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: The sale goes through his gallery, Cate. He’s on the line too. One signature. Half a million dollars

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’ll show your brother.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No. (pointed) That’1ll mean we can stop hitting shitty casinos on the gulf coast.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: I’m out.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Don’t trust him, Deb.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Who said I trust him. INT. CIPRIANI - THIS TIME LUNCH... Deb sits alone waiting for Klaus. Checks her watch. She’s eaten a whole breadbasket. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you Deborah Ocean?  70. She looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb, dressed in an orange jumpsuit carries bedding toward camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie stands in front of her crew -- dressed significant better now. Cate stands off to the side, among the others

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Ok, remember -- this is a run- through. It’s where we make mistakes. Nobody panics, this is why we do this. If something happens and you don’t expect it, it’s no big deal. We roll with it, regroup later. (a beat) Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance, as she puts on her Audio Guide, moves through hours at the Met. A little looser and boozier than the normal crowd. Young professionals mill about.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mark is the The Hotel of Choice for all Gala attendee our Headquarters for the night -- The new, temporary War Room. A monitor shows a mini version of the Security Hub monitors. Nine ball has hacked into the system.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Places, ladies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance puts her foot up on a bench to tie her shoe, ne to where An ELDERLY MUSEUM-GOER sits. Constance takes off her headset, places it on the bench next to her so she ca pull back her hair. The Elderly Museum-Goer rises, gathers her things and departs. Constance does so a few moments after.  71.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (headset) Constance, go -- get moving -- Constance doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder ) I said, “Go!” AN ELDERLY WOMAN... Hears Nine Ball YELLING at her in the Met Audio Guide. Sh taps her headphones.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Looks equally perplexed:

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Who's Winslow Homer? The Elderly Museum-Goer is next to her -- hearing Nine Ba shouts growing more obscene.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MUSEUM-GOER
dialogues.text: Is it supposed to be interactive? Why is this painting yelling at me? Constance looks at the bewildered museum-goer, realizes t headsets have been switched. She takes the REAL one from Elderly Woman’s hand. Back on track.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (on the headset) Back to one. Like you’re coming out of the bathroom. She hurries over to the door of the women’s bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move. Constance emerges and passes Debbie just outside the bathroom. She hands her a string of Mardi Gras beads as a stand-in for the necklace.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Takes off the other direction moving through the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Legit.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie keeps moving past George Bellows, Thomas Hart Bent Eakins, then slows...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Saul? She stops. Turns. Saul Bloom (Carl Reiner) is admiring a painting by William Merrit Chase. She moves closer. He turns as if surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Oh! My goodness. I can’t believe it! Hello -- you look gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: You know. Art. I love this guy. Big fan. He motions toward the painting. Deb stands in front of th label describing the painting.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Who's it by?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Aw, c’mon. Don’t do that. I care about you. Is that a sin?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: When you meddle. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: I'm a 90 year old Jew. Meddling is all that’s left. She starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! He shuffles to keep up with her. Takes her arm...

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we sit down? Saul is a little out of breath. They sit on the padded benches in front of the paintings. Saul’s wipes some swea with a handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t going to work.  73.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You don’t know that. He winces -- an expression of Jewish doubt. Sucks air through his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you still listening to my brother, Saul? He’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: He loved you. He didn’t want you to go to jail.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He had no idea who I was.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Oy. (kids) You can’t argue with a dead person sweetie. My Sadie? I argued with her for years. I’d even go out to the cemetery. You know how crazy that looks -- an old man yelling at tombstone? (pats her hand) Leave it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (looks around the museum) No, you haven't.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This has nothing to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Ok. Come out to the house sometime. We can play cards.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: No way. I’ve played cards with you.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Then we can have some smoked fish.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Deal. She leans over and kisses him on the cheek. Saul smiles. pats her hand.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (lower) If you want to fight with somebody, those guys tailing you are good place to start.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (a whisper) The one’s in the Crown Vic?

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: (impressed) Yeah. (beat) You might be ok after all. He pushes himself up and heads off into the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Crown Victoria sits parked on 80th Street.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET. EDGE OF THE PARK
dialogues.text: Debbie stands in the shadow of a food cart looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men sit at the windshield of the car looking across a the met. Deb turns and heads off into the park... EXT. CENTRAL PARK — LATER The team is already meeting when Debbie arrives. Cate approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Took the long way.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: How’s Saul?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Worried.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: The girls are waiting. I got them all ice cream.  75. Deb nods. Heads off down the path. Cate hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rental car rolls through industrial detritus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we see Cate talking to the owner demonstrating what looks to be the outline of a box with hands. She mimes the dimensions. Roughly two by three...

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK RENTAL AGENCY
dialogues.text: Cate signs an agreement for a plain white panel truck. INT. FISHING STORE - RUSTY’S BAIT AND TACKLE She stands at the counter buying reels of monofilament fishing line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate is in line buying six large iPhones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie wanders out into the fading light to see the Crown Victoria parked down the block.

dialogues.speaker: HER
dialogues.text: Deb crosses to the car and is just about to confront them when she looks up to see... Cate, rounding the corner from the other direction. They pause at the car, smile at each other. Deb taps on the window and they roll it down slowly.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (leaning in) Hey guys. This is my friend Cate. We’re gonna be in for most of the night so if you want to run out and grab a bite or something it’s fine. Cate smiles. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: And if you need a bathroom just knock on the door. There's a good Lebanese place round the corner. The girls turns and head toward the theater.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Where you been?  76.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Odds and ends. As they head inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Over Manhattan. Sunlight peeks over the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Silver Carpet cascades down the front stairs of the M

dialogues.speaker: GAME DAY --
dialogues.text: The MET itself is in WARDROBE PREP -- WORKERS string up thousands of yards of lights -- FLOWERS trucked in -- roses, hydrangeas, peonies. STAFF arrange tables and chairs -- The PRESS STAND is raised -- ASSISTANTS affix seat labels each news outlet in order of importance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CATE’S THEATER - EARLY AFTERNOON A silent ritual. Everyone moves around preparing their pi of the puzzle. A couple of them wear ear buds, in the zon EXT. TIFANNY’S HEADQUARTERS - MORNING An armored car (BRINKS) waits with the engine running. TW GUARDS carry a large-strong box with the HARRINGTON neckl in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne walks in dressed in heels and lingerie, hair in curlers, drinking whiskey. She sits in a Director’s chair a team of make-up people go to town. A MANICURIST takes h hand, another works on her feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six women (Rose is missing), are dressed to the nines in front of a wall mirror. Finishing touches are applied: ha tweaks, mascara, re-applied lipstick...  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRINKS truck arrives in the front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stands at the elevator doors looking up at the floor indicator. As it descends toward her she grows more and m nauseous, stifling a gag as the doors opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne, now in a robe, is getting her hair sprayed, her e shadow blended. She glances in the mirror in front of her see Rose and two men in suits behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Is that it? Rose nods and stands to the side. The two guards from Tiffany’s move into the room, carrying a large velvet jew box. There is a weird ceremony to all of this: the place goes quiet; the men march forward in an even cadence. Ros crosses behind Daphne as the Harrington is revealed...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROSE
dialogues.text: She reaches forward and opens the top of Daphne’s robe, revealing the nape of her neck. Rose puts the Harrington around her neck and fastens the clasp: it sounds like tumblers clicking.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Might be a little cold.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: And heavy. The mirror glitters -- it’s almost celestial.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (deep breath) Ok. Let’s get this off and get you dressed. She reaches up and starts to fiddle with the clasp which doesn’t seem to open.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS, (TIFFANY GUARD)
dialogues.text: Oh -- can’t get it off like that. He steps forward pulling out a small pen like cylinder.  78.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Special clasp. Needs this magnet. Titus crosses behind her and fits the device over the cla He gives it a half turn and the necklace unlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is somewhere between ashen and light green. Rose take quick shallow gasps clutching the arm of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Oh that’s... Brill--iant. (forced smile) Let me see that again. Titus, full of pride fastens the clasp, then shows the sm magnetic cylinder like a magician demonstrating a trick.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Takes in all of this from the mirror. The necklace. Titus behind her... and behind him Rose who steadies herself wi one hand, clutching her iPhone in the other. DAPHNE’S POV. ROSE’S IPHONE (TIGHT) She points it at the back of Daphne’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women have loaded most of a white panel truck and are about to head out when Debbie gets a text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the same color as Rose. Motions for Cate.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Not... (tries to swallow) ...Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of Titus’ hand turning the clasp.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: (on the video) “See it’s the magnet that does it.”  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ball’s little sister Veronica (15 years old) is capturing a Pokemon Go character on her fire escape. Her phone rings, interrupting the capture.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I was about to catch a Rhyhorn, Leslie. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They huddle around a speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (turns) Leslie?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: I'll kill you. (to her sister) We're in a jam, sis. Need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica has an array of magnets spread over the seat bes her. She tries to look at the shaky video, speaking to Ni Ball on the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I think I got it. Just a magnet with double A battery. I'’11 give her a positive and a negative pole so she can flip around when she’s using it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate drives. Everyone hangs on the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Awesome, V.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Really? She fixed it? Nine Ball shoots a look: “of course she fixed it.”  80.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (suddenly points) Whoa! THEIR POV. THE MET... The bleachers are in place, the carpet out, spotlights positioned, cameras everywhere -- it looks almost regal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open to reveal -- Daphne who looks STUNNING in a long-sleeve black velvet d that hugs every curve. A twelve foot train, and a plungin neckline frame the world's most valuable necklace.

dialogues.speaker: THE MET LOADING DOCK
dialogues.text: The van screeches to a halt. Debbie bolts from the passengers door. Veronica does the same looking for her sister when she hears a loud whistle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica appears jogging through a children’s playground Stan Smiths and a vintage flower dress. She runs up to De and her sister.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: That shit is hectic over there. Got chased by a cop.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: This is my sister, Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Hey. Veronica hands her the magnet.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Very tight. I owe you.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Just get me a new ID. And she jogs away.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What do your parents do?  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bleachers are in place, the carpet out, spotlights pi the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOUSANDS of them, refracting off the silver carpet.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE --
dialogues.text: The dress somehow looks more radiant on the silver carpet with the full-effect of the train --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: On her arm. Looks like just another accessory, albeit a handsome one. The FLASHES go even crazier. He steps aside to allow...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE
dialogues.text: -- her moment in the limelight. She basks (nervously) as name “ROSE WEIL” ECHOES over the PA system --

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Is in deep BG, following Rose, following Daphne.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (into her earpiece) You got the paste?

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (replying) Copy. She is dwarfed by the Necklace’s security guards -- JUDAS Titus.

dialogues.speaker: A HALAL CART
dialogues.text: Steaming shawarma wafts through the air. The outside is decorated with glossy laminated photos of their cuisine.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HALAL CART
dialogues.text: Nine Ball is set up with a full console of monitors, a wo station and headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With each arriving LIMO there is a bigger and more beauti

dialogues.speaker: STAR --
dialogues.text: Sarah Jessica Parker in Oscar de le Renta, Rihanna in Alexander Wang, Taylor Swift in Prada, Kim Kardashian and Kanye West in Balmain. Haute Couture Mayhem -- as the cameras and crowds go wild

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting her limo, looking pretty damn amazing in her own gown, but no one takes much notice of her. It’s a pretty dress. No twelve foot train, but way better than an orang jump suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s been transformed. The huge entrance hall is now the grandest ballroom in the world. Debbie scans the famous faces finally settling on...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE AND KLAUS
dialogues.text: Now a glamorous couple. All Deb’s own doing and still it stings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball eats a falafel at the same time. Cate hovers behind her buttoning a chef's toque. She stares at the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Places check --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing final checks over the tables, speaks into her heads

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Ready to sit --

dialogues.speaker: THE PARTY
dialogues.text: At full steam in the Costume Exhibit -- The party-goers move down four mirrored hallways, passing glass cases that show off --  83.

dialogues.speaker: DRESSES MADE OF JEWELS
dialogues.text: Rubies, diamonds and emeralds from the House of Worth, Chanel, Dior, Givenchy... DAPHNE AND KLAUS... Stroll through the exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: She watches them.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE AND KLAUS
dialogues.text: Utterly unfazed, they pause in front of: A matte black infinity. The room looks like it extends fo football field. The black sky is punctuated by FLOATING JEWELS -- each their own supernova: Diamonds, sapphires, rubies, emeralds, they gleam as if emitting their own lig They float in space, suspended from the ceiling, each describing an invisible human form. It’s like Yayoi Kusam Infinity room but way cooler and A LOT MORE EXPENSIVE. A million dots of light into infinity -- a celestial wonder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate watches THE MONITOR, where Klaus Gunther leans over whispers something to Daphne who throws her head back in peel of laughter. Cate doesn't react. She turns and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stage at the front of the hall, a jazz quartet pla The room fills with slightly lubricated guests. Everyone migrates toward their seats, appraises dresses they’ve ye see, people with whom they haven’t schmoozed -- TAMMY OBSERVES... DAPHNE AND KLAUS: a suprisingly-great-first-date energy between them. They move to their table -- ROSE... Already sits, enjoying her second glass of wine. Daphne a Klaus take their place next to her. (Top designers are always seated next to the “designed.”) CONSTANCE... Does a pass by of the table -- glances down at the clasp.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s sitting in the middle of Daphne’s neck like the whee a safe.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Clutches the small “pen light” magnet, practicing -- work it in her fingers. She drifts off into the party... ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PARTY... Debbie hasn’t taken her eyes off of Daphne and Klaus. He leans in and whispers to Daphne, half nibbling her ear. Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball watches Klaus still nibbling Daphne’s ear on th monitor. It’s gross even in low res video.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Okay, we're ready. Countdown -- in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate now dressed in her toque, turns to a waiter:

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Table 3: we need a vegan and a plain broiled fish... (as if a throw-away) Where’s the soup for table one?

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Over here. She sees the bowls lined up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate pulls the small brown bottle from her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON A BOWL OF SOUP
dialogues.text: We move with the steaming (now spiked) bisque through the greatest party in the world. Gliding by peripherally on t EDGES OF THE FRAME are glimpses of: Selena Gomez, Michael Jordan, Megyn Kelly, Laverne Cox, Neil Patrick Harris etc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Klaus is, not surprisingly, holding court.  85.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: .-.-But then again, I’ve always been a keen admirer of the female form.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Huh? The Soup lands in front of Daphne. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Oh, thank God. She grabs her spoon and instead of bringing cutlery to mo she reverses the process, nearly plunging into the steami bowl. Daphne is four spoons deep before she ever breathes DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) (re: her dress) I haven't eaten in three days. She wipes her soup moustache with the back of her hand an plunges back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one else is eating. Klaus stares at Daphne’s mouthful soup bread --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (yeah, dickhead, I’m hungry) What? Judas and Titus stand on the outskirts of the Temple.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (into headset) She's in deep. Maybe half a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball watches the scene on her monitors --

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Alright everybody. Here it comes. INT. WOMEN’S BATHROOM All done up with fancy table stands offering beauty produ and mints and floral arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Blows into the room.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: We're up.  86. INT. TEMPLE OF DENDUR - DAPHNE’S TABLE

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: So I have three brothers right -- totally vicious growing up. They would plan it out -- like pinto beans the night before, then in the morning two of them would hold me down while -- whoa. Daphne holds her stomach. The digestion is audible -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) ...Cause you know -- brothers can be... (audible stomach rumble) God DAMN. All at once Daphne bolts from the table flailing in searc a bathroom. Judas and Titus follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Into her headset...

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Game on.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Makes for the bathroom as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne elbows a MATRON out of the way just as --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Converges on the bathroom door. She wedges herself betwee Daphne and Titus, who follows a step behind her. DEBBIE. Excuse me. He starts to push past her.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon. That’s the ladies room. She plants herself between Titus and the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down at her monitor. No Deb.  87.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: That’s good... You’re right in the blind spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne barrels into the door, hand over mouth -- She flings open the door to reveal Constance about to sit the toilet -- all according to plan.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Oh, my --

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: As Daphne removes her hand, a torrent of vomit flows into toilet -- the noise is loud and painful, as if her stomac being excavated. After several wretches, Constance soothes her, strokes Daphne’s hair. The side of her cheek. The back of her neck...

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: There, there -- Another wretch. CONSTANCE (CONT’D) You poor thing. TIGHT. CONSTANCE’S HAND. SLOW MOTION She pops the magnet out of her glove and fits it deftly o the clasp. A half twist and it doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts into frame bilious, gasps, then disappear all o again, hurling. RESUME. EXTREME CLOSE UP. CONSTANCE’S HAND She flips it around from the positive to the negative pol and fits it over the clasp. A half turn and the SOUND OF TUMBLERS .

dialogues.speaker: TIGHTER
dialogues.text: The Harrington comes loose falling out of frame...  88.

dialogues.speaker: MID-AIR. SLOW MOTION
dialogues.text: As a necklace falls, Constance deftly catches it...

dialogues.speaker: A DIFFERENT STALL
dialogues.text: Constance bolts inside, starts wiggling out of her gown..

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Still looking at her bank of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Grabs a bus boy who is carrying a tray of dirty dishes.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Don’t dawdle. Get that stuff into the kitchen. And she guides him along the wall right past...

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Where Constance exits, now wearing a server’s uniform, he hair pulled back. She moves past Debbie, crosses paths wi the busboy and deftly slips the Harrington Necklace into pile of dirty dishes.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Takes it all in...

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL AND MONITORS
dialogues.text: Nothing on the cameras. Then, the bus boy appears (emergi from the blind spot) carrying a tray of dirty dishes. Non of the women are anywhere to be found. TRACKING SHOT. WITH BUS BOY... He glides down the hall on his way to the kitchen where..

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Waits for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ball is charting is progress on the overhead monitor  89.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Almost there...

dialogues.speaker: THE BUSBOY
dialogues.text: As he heads toward the kitchen, then suddenly sees a frie and_stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another busboy having deposited dirty dishes, pauses to gossip in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Dude. Gigi Hadid? Did you see that dress?

dialogues.speaker: BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Did you see Emily Rata-whatever. That’s insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate waits near the entrance to the loading dock looking toward the door. She leans into her headset.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: (whisper) Where is he? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hears the chatter on her headset.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball leans into the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: They're stalled in the hallway. Chatting. TAMMY... Hears it and takes off toward the kitchen. She catches up the busboy carrying a tray of dirty dishes and a hundred million dollar necklace.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: BUSBOY
dialogues.text: Sorry.  90.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: You're not getting paid to talk. Get in there.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING THE BUS BOY
dialogues.text: As he heads up the hallway into...

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Steam. Shouting. Rattling plates. But where Cate was standing, now, there is...

dialogues.speaker: NO ONE
dialogues.text: Cate is gone. The busboy enters looking for a dish washin station.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (over the headset) Anybody got eyes on Cate?

dialogues.speaker: AMITA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here! I’11 take those.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amita is scouring the cutlery dressed as a dishwasher. Th bus boy dumps his tray into her sink and heads back towar the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into the soapy water and fishes around throug the slime. All at once she stops; knows that feeling. Ami fishes 150 million dollars out of the goop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s covered with gunk but still glistens. Amita grabs th overhead nozzle and rinses off the Harrington necklace un it gleams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sticks it into her pocket and calls out to the rest o the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Bathroom break!

dialogues.speaker: HER
dialogues.text: Amita crosses to the bathroom and locks the door behind h  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single toilet. Sink. Tampon dispenser. Changing table. Amita draws a long breath and takes out the Harrington. W Then she opens the tampon dispenser, displaying a full ar of jewlers tools, neatly organized and fastened.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Dope. She grabs the loupe and slips it on her head, then turns opens the changing table: a work bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ball is scanning the various images.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (into headset) Where’s Cate. Anybody? Need eyes on Cate.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO THE LADIES ROOM
dialogues.text: Debbie is still loitering outside the door. Feels like forever. She glances at Titus then back at her watch...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (to Nine Ball/in headset) Forget her. Stay focused.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You’re avoiding me. Debbie turns to see... TAMMY standing next to her.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (presses close) Seriously. We were going to talk when I started, and then there was so much to get ready for, and then when I wanted to have a bigger conversation you said everyone was around and we needed time if we wanted to have a “real” talk. So TI thought great she wants to have a “real” talk, but...  92.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Can we just do this later?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: That’s all you ever say.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Like a hundred million dollars later?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: There’s never a good time.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Honestly Tam, there are better times than this.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Ok. And she walks away shaken but proud of herself for having such an important, if difficult, conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne comes out, pale green -- very pale. Wipes her mouth...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: That was gnarly.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: Looks relieved -- then not... HIS POV. CLOSE UP. DAPHNE KLUGER’S DECOLLETAGE The Harrington Necklace is missing.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (feeling their stares) What? One of them (gently) grabs her. The other pushes past her into the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has removed the first diamond from the Harrington and holds it up to her loupe. Slight gasp.  93. EDGE OF THE DINING ROOM... Debbie watches the panic build. Daphne is surrounded by a security team who escort her back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. It could have fallen off back here. Or maybe in there... I don’t know, I just barfed an organ out... The phalanx moves toward the table. Walkie-talkies crackl More security descend on the room.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Are you alright? Oh, you poor dear.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: What’s going on? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: It must have fallen off, or --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (seeing the missing necklace) Are you joking with me?

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: (approaching) Nothing in the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Maybe a spot of tea...

dialogues.speaker: JUDAS
dialogues.text: They're sealing the exits.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Exits being sealed now. Amita?

dialogues.speaker: AMITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on the headset) Two earrings and a bracelet. We're five minutes ahead.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And they're nice.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (checks the monitors) Excellent. Sweeping the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire party is being guided into the foyer by securi guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the guests have been cleared out leaving the plac weirdly empty -- a restaurant at closing time. Daphne and Klaus are talking to security while people search the pla

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) I am just so sorry... (a distinction) For real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s completely empty. Silent. Glistening. Now it does look like outer space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GALA ORGANIZER speaks into a wireless microphone.

dialogues.speaker: GALA ORGANIZER
dialogues.text: (too close -- feedback) Um -- we apologize for this interruption but -- someone has misplaced a rather expensive item and they tell us we’re going to have to stay here while they search. I’ve told them this needs to happen quickly so I’m sure it will. I’m confident that we will all be back to dessert shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the security teams furiously searches, Tammy is perche the far side of the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whispers into her headset --

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: They’re at table three, seven and ten. Still a crowd around table one. Give it a second.  95.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Rodger that. Super chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been combed over. Several of the security team gla at each other. Nothing. They move on to table two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amita works furiously. She’s already fashioned four sets earrings, three rings, two necklaces. She works on a bracelet. A POUND at the door --

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: (calling out) I’m oc-u-pied... She stares down at the completed bracelet in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security guards use handheld metal detectors to comb thro the waitstaff --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Once you’ve been checked, please head toward the far exit -- The kitchen staff begins to clear out. Still no Cate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONSTANCE comes blowing through the entrance and slams in

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Who is heading in the other direction. CLOSE UP. SLOW MOTION... Constance’s left hand deftly slips the PASTE (THE ONE FRO THE 3D PRINTER) into Tammy’s hand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball speaks into her headset.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: All going down. Police coming, Tiffany’s coming. Bunch of news reporters coming. Shit’s blowin’ up.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne sits at her table, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: Ms. Kluger -- was there anything you did or anyone you talked to between your table and the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I was barfing.

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: I understand that. Do you remember still having the necklace when you were seated at...

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Oh my god! (loud, eager)

dialogues.speaker: FOUND IT
dialogues.text: They turn. TAMMY... Pulls the necklace from a crease in the table cloth holdi up the necklace (PASTE) like a trophy.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Thank fucking God.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: It was under the tablecloth -- ina crease. In the table. You know where they fold... (re: security) Maybe you just didn’t see it the first time or something...

dialogues.speaker: TITUS
dialogues.text: (into his earpiece) We got it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amita cleans up her workstation -- she wears a new pair o BRILLIANT earrings. A knock on the door. Amita opens it.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Slides in the bathroom.  97.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: (sees the jewels) Wo. Sick. Constance starts pocketing the rest of the new jewelery.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: Be careful. There’s glue. Constance nods (sure whatever). Slips out of the room whi is now just... A bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball emerges from her falafel stand wearing couture. She heads across the street toward the Met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne now stands on the stairs above the main hall, whil Klaus (gallantly) places the necklace around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: If I may... Cameras flash, seizing upon the intimate moment.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA WINTOUR
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ms. Kluger, for the excitement. (a beat, to the crowd) Let's finish the party, shall we. Everyone files back in -- calm, bonded by the trauma, joy a little less formal and more fun --

dialogues.speaker: LONG LENS. CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: As she moves through the party... Past Tammy... Past Rose pounding down a last glass of champagne... Past Nine Ball who is now a radiant partygoer.... Finally face to face with DEBBIE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance pretends to trip, grabs onto Debbie momentarily

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. ‘Scuse me. Constance catches her balance and moves on.  98.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Looks down at a gorgeous diamond necklace in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Bennett and Lady Gaga perform “Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend.” The entire party is happy and boozed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Constance exits the Museum, back in her ball gown -- hot pink, strapless, and satin -- now adorned with a beautifu diamond pendant and matching earrings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amita, too, has changed into a ball gown -- Deep purple offset by diamonds and emeralds that dangle from her ears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine Ball emerges in an impeccable satin tuxedo with a massive ring and matching necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy descends. Forest green a-line dress -- a strand of diamonds looped twice around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose swaggers out, a little loose and loving it -- a_new diamond choker gracing her neck. Debbie floats down the steps -- wearing her new necklace chain choker in the front and a long drop chain cascading down her backless dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Cate. Debbie checks her watch. Glances around. Is just about to check it again when she looks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transformed, descending the stairs in a bright yellow bal gown wearing long dangling diamond earrings. She locks ey with Debbie. Slight nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neon signs in the window, “ATM,” “COFFEE,” “OPEN.” The be on the door ring -- Amita enters, sits at the counter. Sh looks at the menu. Constance enters --

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Just one -- She takes a seat a couple stools down from Amita. Nine Ba arrives, nods to the other women, sits. Tammy enters, sti scrolling on her phone. Rose comes, still wasted.  99. She tries to play the claw-game -- but she hasn’t put in money. She finds her way to the counter --

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Oh, helloooo. Debbie and Cate enter together, taking the two middle sea They all wear the jewels as they look up and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks Edward Hopper’s Nighthawks but instead of normal patrons there are eight women wearing over 200 million dollars in jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. TIFFANY’S VAULT - DAY The two large Security Guards carry the box down the hall toward the waiting associate. ANGLE ON - THE ASSOCIATE’S FACE As he lifts the lid. He wears a loupe. He takes the necklace up in his hand, inspects in under the light -- And nearly PASSES OUT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-school yellow cab screeches up. JOHN FRAZIER, late 40's, Men’s Warehouse suit from his ye trip to the Hackensack outlet, salt-of-the-earth, exits. inhales, looks around, heads in. INT. TIFFANY’S CONFERENCE ROOM - LATER The Tiffany’s Associate sits at the table, shaking, givin into the fact that even in his worst nightmares he could conjure up the circumstance which he is now experiencing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: So you're certain the necklace in your possession is a paste? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE (shudders) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: And when did you last see what you believe to be the authentic item?  100. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Last night, in Ms. Kluger’s suite.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Now Larry -- may I call you Larry? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Lawrence --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: My experience is, sooner or later people want to be rewarded for their patience. (takes out a toothpick, picks with vigilance) A necklace that’s been sitting ina vault for 30 years isn’t doing anyone any good. Nobody’s seen it, no one even knows what it is. But you place that necklace on a very well-known young lady, on an evening where said placement gets lots of play and attention and all of sudden everyone and their mother knows about that necklace. That necklace becomes very famous, very quickly -- right? TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Yes...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: And then if that necklace goes missing? John grabs every daily paper from his bag, throws them on table -- all the headlines are about the NECKLACE. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Well what else would people talk about? That’s a tale of scandal and intrigue that gets people talking and buying. (almost whispers) And what they don’t know is it is insured for $270 million -- so now you're up a quarter billion dollars, your name’s in everyone's mouth, and you’re missing a little necklace that no one had ever seen anyway. You get the publicity and the money. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE Are you accusing us --  101.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Merely floating a theory -- (smiles) That's my job. See if it were me, I'd do it early in the night. Get it off our hands quick. TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE What are you suggesting?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Speculating. That it wasn’t the real necklace to begin with. That someone swapped it out before it even went on Ms. Kluger’s neck -- TIFFANY’S ASSOCIATE I guarantee the necklace on Ms. Kluger’s neck when she left that hotel was the real one -- John Frazier shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: So tell me again how you remember it.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TIFFANY’S CONFERENCE ROOM - LATER John stands in front of four massive cloth covered boards he has transformed the Conference Room into Ground Zero f his investigation.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: They put the necklace on me, I did my silly walk, we saw the exhibit, I ate my soup, hurled my guts out -- The necklace was gone, everyone freaked out and then they found the necklace again. Frazier takes the clothes off the boards behind him -- th reveal Daphne’s entire night reconstructed with images fr Getty, Buzzfeed, Instagram, Paparazzi and Security footag In most of the images, Klaus is standing right next to he

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Ms. Kluger. Fortunately, I’ve been able to trace every step of your night as relying on your memory would be -- well -- less dependable considering your level of refreshment. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So as you can see in all of these photos, there is a young man standing next to you -- Mr. Klaus Von Gunther?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: He was my date --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: (amazed) Is that his real name?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: German?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Austrian.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Six o’ one. Was there ever a time when you two were alone while you were wearing the necklace? Daphne locks eyes with him --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE AND KLAUS, (FLASHBACK)
dialogues.text: Passionately making out against a wall in a dark corner o Gallery --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - TIFANY’S - RESUME

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: No. John looks over the images of Klaus and Daphne -- he is touching her neck a lot, as if coveting the necklace. Joh sits on the edge of the table --

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Do you suspect he would have any motivations to take the necklace?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I try not to guess about people’s motivations. They tend to show you.  103.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: That's a sufficiently vague answer. (beat -- looks at the board) You know, I have every minute accounted for except five -- He looks down at a sheet of paper on the table -- JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Well, four minutes, 48 seconds to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I was probably rubbing one out.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: They said you were charming. (beat) Funnily enough, the unaccounted for minutes do line up with when you were disposed by your sickness.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: When I was throwing up?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Was there anyone in the bathroom with you at the time?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: My head was at the bottom of a toilet bowl.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: How bout after --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Lots of people.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: I mean in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Don’t you have cameras in there?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Sadly no. Legal thing. Whoever took this necklace is pretty smart and probably a woman. Or someone dressed as such. Or maybe this German fellow but that’s a bit of a reach. He lays out photos of Daphne with Rose, Tammy, and Debbie the background -- they are zoomed in or from the edges of photos of her -- the cobbling together took a long time.  104. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Do you know any of these women?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: That’s Rose Weil, she designed my gown, which you obviously know, that chick was some type of event planner, I think, and her -- I’ve never seen before in my life. INT. CATE’S THEATER - DAY The team dismantles their headquarters. The replica of th main exhibit still stands in the background. Everyone glances up at the sound of heels clicking against the woo the stage...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: You guys are fucked. She enters from stage right and wanders over to a large investigation board -- DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) Wow. It’s like everyone watched Homeland and got ideas -- Photos of Klaus and Daphne throughout the night -- he see enamoured with the necklace. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) (re: the board) Can I keep this?

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: You're trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: We asked her to come. Daphne grabs an apple from the table and plops (crash-lan on the couch. All eyes turn to Debbie and Cate.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (deep breath) I realized about a week ago that Ms. Kluger...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Wasn’t a total fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Might have gotten a sense of what we were doing.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big guy and bald guy are parked outside Cate’s Wareho A knuckle raps on the window. It rolls down to reveal --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Who extends a folded note.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Chuck. Victor. Hi. Could you take this to your boss please. I’d like a word with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne drinks something green as she reads Deb’s note.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: And there’s some paparazzi outside too, Ms. Kluger.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (engrossed/reading the note) Shh.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME. WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: The rest of the women pay rapt attention.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: So we figured the only way this might work was to take her into our confidence. Daphne takes a huge bite of her granny smith.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (mouthful) I even threw up for real.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: You were in the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Recently.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHANE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (preens ) One take, baby.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: And it seemed to us -- that eight shares of a hundred and thirty million are better than seven shares of nothing. Right?  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sinks in to the whole group. Awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHANE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Wo. Chilly. (beat) “Hi Daph, welcome to the team.” Let’s not all high five at once. (another bite of apple) Plus, I’m the one who’s saving your ass from insurance fraud.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Insurance fraud?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I was getting to that.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: It seems that RGI has assigned an investigator who...

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Is about to look up your ass with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (panicked) Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Little Colombo dude. Totally onto you. Everything but the trench- coat. Do you guys have anything to drink?

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Alright... Lest we forget. This... This entire... “enterprise” was to keep me out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to jail. We expected this. We’re very prepared.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Looks like it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: WE are not going to be the prime suspects.  107.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I'd go to jail with you, Deb.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Well that’s very nice but...

dialogues.speaker: CONSTANCE
dialogues.text: Who are the prime suspects?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: That German creep who sent her away. (beat) Don’t you watch any movies -- like Double Indemnity? These insurance guys are smart. You gotta frame somebody else. Cate and Deb exchange a look. Moment of truth. Beat...

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Of course you do. Deb nods. Daphne kicks off her shoes, putting her bare fe on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: I know I look like Daphne Kluger, but I only play her in real life. (beat) So when do we sell this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb sits at a table near the back. Saul approaches with a WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Rene, this is Deborah, Deborah this is Renee.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Rene is a very talented actress. (beat) As are her friends. With all that implies.

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: (grand dame) Hello darling.  108.

dialogues.speaker: SAUL
dialogues.text: Well, I’1ll leave you two. (winks ) Nice goin’ kid. INT. PRESIDENT’S OFFICE - DAY Rene meets with the lead APPRAISER. She’s dressed like a Waspy Jessica Rabbit. The appraiser wears a loupe, inspec the ring -- he is astonished --

dialogues.speaker: SOTHEBY EXEC
dialogues.text: Stunning -- it may be the most flawless diamond I have ever seen. This was your mother’s?

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: Left to me after her passing. “Rene -- the ring is yours.” Quite sappy, really. A Swedish Prince gave it to her while she was traveling in Europe as a young woman. In exchange for her “deflowering,” one can only assume. The Appraiser smiles -- examines it -- thinks...

dialogues.speaker: SOTHEBY EXEC
dialogues.text: Well, next week’s auction is our premiere event of the season. It would be hard to take on a single item.

dialogues.speaker: RENE
dialogues.text: Of course, we’re happy to pay the full commission. He looks up... Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: On the phone --

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Working like a charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETHEL, a similar high class dowager, sits opposite the sa Appraiser. She’s been weeping.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: Parting with something like this. It’s so hard.  109.

dialogues.speaker: SOTHEBY EXEC
dialogues.text: I’m sure --

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: We were on the deck of the Queen Mary -- North Atlantic in the moonlight. (stifles a sob) Then he says, “I'd give you those stars if I could...” Oh well...

dialogues.speaker: MARLENE, (EASTERN EUROPEAN)
dialogues.text: Sits in the same chair as he examines a flawless bracelet

dialogues.speaker: MARLENE
dialogues.text: (eastern European) What does a refugee have? What you can put in your pocket. “Take this,” my mother said. “Now go.” So we ran. Istanbul, Vienna, finally London. I put it ina drawer forever but... what’s forever?

dialogues.speaker: SOTHEBY EXEC
dialogues.text: It’s a beautiful piece.

dialogues.speaker: MARLENE
dialogues.text: Those are her initials right there.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA, (OLDER THAN THE OTHERS)
dialogues.text: Sits in the same chair, staring intently at a diamond rin which gives Elizabeth Taylor’s a run for its money. She studies it, trying to summon a recollection. She gives up

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: I just don’t remember. I stare at it and stare at it and I just can’t remember. Is it worth something? The rock is as big as a kumquat --

dialogues.speaker: SOTHEBY EXEC
dialogues.text: Um. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That's nice. I just wish I could remember...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RENE’S APARTMENT The crew of criminally-inclined octogenarians celebrate -  110.

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: That was fun. CLINK. Rene, Ethel, Marlene, and Diana all touch glasses.

dialogues.speaker: THE HAMPTONS
dialogues.text: Klaus is walking through the dunes staring earnestly out the horizon, hoping someone is watching him. Unfortunatel someone is.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ex-cuse me... Klaus turns to see the middle aged man stumbling through sea grass. JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in a HUGE living room looking out at the beauty wild beach.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Look. You’re gonna have to pronounce your name for me ‘cause...

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Klaus... Gunther.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Funny. You’re very funny. Really. Klaus glares. Get on with it. John Frazier opens a folder JOHN FRAZIER (CONT’D) So these are photographs of you with Ms. Kluger. As you can see there are many with your hand on the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I don’t really remember where my hands were.  111.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Ah, to be young. (smiles) Problem is, there’s a missing necklace and a fake in its place. And you’re the one closest to her with the greatest opportunity to...

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Why would I want to steal a necklace?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: That's what I kept asking myself. When you were on the beach. I kept walking around here going, “why would this guy who has everything, wanna steal a necklace?”

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: You were in my house?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: The door was open.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Do you have a warrant?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: (laughs) Gosh no. I work for an insurance company.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Then I think we’re done here. Pause. Tense silence.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (rising) Really. John Frazier nods. Didn’t even finish his Coke.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Could you call me a taxi?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KLAUS’ GALLERY He’s selling a very abstract piece to a couple from Norwa

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Exactly. It’s what isn’t there... No one understands negative space like... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (his cell phone vibrates) ‘Excuse me --— (answers ) Hello. It’s Daphne --

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaus sitting on a bench. He’s looking down toward the en of the island. Boats glide by. He fights the sun. FROM FAR AWAY... DAPHNE’S SILHOUETTE... Approaches from down-river. She wears a black trench coat cinched at the waist and high heels considering the walk. would make anyone sit up and take notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neon. Car horns. Buses.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Presses her way out of the subway -- fighting through the throng.

dialogues.speaker: HER
dialogues.text: Through street vendors and tourists. Every nut imaginable She turns into the blinding light of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DING of the door -- she glances around. The HOSTESS stands above a basket of mints --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I’m meeting someone. MOVING WITH HER... Debbie goes up three booths, sits down --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Hello, Debbie. A long pause.  She takes 113.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t do this one.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: That’s what you said in Philly.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I know. But I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: (offering) Pickle? one. Crunchy...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Let’s say I knew where part of the necklace was -- hot goods -- totally traceable... Could you get a search warrant?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Don’t know. Depends who’s got it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Stop fishing. This is me.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Well -- we’d need probable cause.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Let’s play a game? She's still wearing the trench coat but it’s partially unbuttoned. Her shoes are next to her -- She leans

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: (struggles to talk) What kind of game?

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: (sex game) You know. Like a “card” game. in, intoxicating. Klaus shudders slightly...

dialogues.speaker: LATER...
dialogues.text: Cards and underwear are strewn about the bed. Bottle of vodka lies empty. Klaus is in a post-coital coma, the lif sucked out of him. He doesn't know his own name. INT. KLAUS’ CLOSET DAPHNE, wearing his shirt, looks at his dresser. Pictures him. Him and his friends (male). But mainly just him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All at once, she places a ten thousand dollar bracelet in front of a safari photograph (Klaus shirtless.) Daphne positions her iPhone and CLICK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb takes her phone, shows it to John --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This kind of probable cause?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks down at the bracelet on Klaus’ dresser.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN FRAZIER
dialogues.text: Yeah, that works.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT - THE NEXT MORNING 10:03AM on the digital clock. Sunlight invades the blacko shades.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: Stirs. Looks at the clock. Looks across the bed. Daphne's gone. He gets up slowly... Needs to pee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half a bottle of vodka thunders into the toilet. Klaus stretches, heads into the closet. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A note sits next to the bracelet and the photograph...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHTER. BRACELET
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of diamonds. He picks it up, utterly confuse There is KNOCKING at the front door. It turns to pounding EXT. KLAUS’ APARTMENT Police. Lots of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAVEL pounds. Murmurs die down.

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: Lot number 63. The Miedenfause Jewels, including a 33.18 D-color internally flawless diamond ring --

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: In the audience, looking to her companion --

dialogues.speaker: DIANA
dialogues.text: (faintly, lost) Is that one mine?

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bidding will begin at 5 million -- Paddles shoot up in the air -- AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) 5.6 In the front. Do I have 6? Here, yes, to the gentleman in the back. Do I hear five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience as paddles rise until we find --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Perusing the Auction catalogue. She looks up, smiles, as Gavel SLAMS. AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) Sold for 7.9 Million -- As each lot of jewels provided by Rene’s crew get sold -- AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) Sold for 6.7 Million. The gavel SLAMS again.  116. AUCTIONEER (CONT’D) 9.5 Million. The Auctioneer looks like he needs a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klaus sits at a plain wooden table, aghast at his surroundings. A detective stands in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: You have no idea how this came to be in your possession.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: But you were Ms. Kluger’s date the night these necklaces were switched.

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Does that strike you as an amazing coincidence?

dialogues.speaker: KLAUS
dialogues.text: I think I ought to talk to my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: (smiles) I think that’s a good idea. INT. CATE’S WAREHOUSE The Crew celebrating -- everyone is drinking. Congratulations all around. Then --

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I got a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns to look at Daphne who is sitting on a crat perplexed. She looks down at her iPhone where she’s been working the calculator.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: So you sold ‘bout 35 million worth of jewelry right?  117. Pause. She lowers the phone. DAPHNE KLUGER (CONT’D) How does everyone get 16 million a piece? All eyes on Debbie. They wait to see what she’s going to Ok -- why not?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What? -- You thought we were just going to steal ONE necklace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne and Klaus stare at the main hall of the exhibit --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: On the other side, staring longingly at them. But she wasn’t. Now we know the real of object of her affection: The whole exhibit itself.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: See, while everyone was worrying about what was around your neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daphne violently vomits into the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And you were hurling your brains out -- thank you for that, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE
dialogues.text: (professional) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire party is escorted out into the main hall --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -- the whole place went into lock down --  118.

dialogues.speaker: DAPHNE KLUGER
dialogues.text: Oh, that’s smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cate, in her chef’s uniform, pushes a huge catering cart

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then, when security made us clear out the kitchen -- On the other end of the catering cart is revealed --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Pulling it down the hall -- now wearing a janitors unifor

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: And everybody was watching the entrance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catering cart comes to a stop--

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: We cleared out too -- just like we were told.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Crosses around to the front of the catering oven and open the double doors revealing... Yen (the chinese acrobat from Ocean’s Eleven) He extends a bright yellow ball gown to her on a hanger.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Why would you steal one necklace when you could steal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie crosses to the large industrial fridge and swings the door, revealing all the jewels from exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: .--More.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: See, we didn’t just print the Harrington out of that thing. We printed lots of jewels. FLASHBACK. CATE’S LOFT. TWO WEEKS EARLIER. Deb and Amita watch as the 3D printer spits out loads of cubic zirconium.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Felt like I worked at Kinkos.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE HEIST., (OUTSIDE THE KITCHEN)
dialogues.text: Yen hops up on the catering cart and gives Cate a hand. S climbs on it as well, putting Yen on her shoulders. Debbi holds the cart as Yen pops open a vent climbing into the ceiling. A moment later, a rope drops down.

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: How long did you have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: (volunteering) Twelve minutes and thirty eight seconds --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK. EVENT
dialogues.text: Anna Wintour is making her announcement:

dialogues.speaker: ANNA WINTOUR
dialogues.text: Um -- we apologize for this interruption but -- someone has misplaced a rather expensive item...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yen, Debbie and Cate crawl through the vent.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now, when we modified the exhibit, we also changed the background from reflective black to matte black. No big deal, except it was the exact same material our good friend Yen was wearing.  120. We see Yen -- hooded from head to two black lower himself into the exhibit.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: So even though he was visible to us from the vent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cloaked figure of Yen hangs in space --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: He was invisible to the security cameras against the black background...

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Watches from her bank of monitors. She sees nothing on he screen.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME. LOFT
dialogues.text: They all sit mesmerized...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: But since it would have been bad to see the jewels move, Nine Ball here helped us customized the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
