dialogues.text: I just changed the specs a little online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes an iPhone, snaps a picture of the exhibit and sl it into a special housing on the front of the security camera.

dialogues.speaker: NINE BALL
dialogues.text: Sees a momentary blur then the exhibit looking perfectly normal --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Now all of the jewels are weighted. But when you know the piece, and the exact karats, it’s easy to calculate that weight.

dialogues.speaker: AMITA
dialogues.text: It’s just a little math.  121.

dialogues.speaker: CATE AND DEBBIE IN THE VENT
dialogues.text: Loop the fishing line Cate bought at the tackle shop, ove metal roller with a digital pressure meter. Carefully the lower the paste to YEN... Who deftly shifts the weight from one to the other, resto the exhibit. It looks like the jewels move on their own.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: So as we reeled down one, we reeled in another. DEBBIE. IN THE VENT... ...-hoists a large bracelet into her hands. First of many INSERT. NINE BALL’S MONITOR On the monitor, Debbie and Cate begin to wheel their “catering cart” nonchalantly toward the truck.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I know you all went through a lot to steal that necklace.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: But without a decoy. We never could have done it. INT. COSTUME EXHIBIT — FLASHBACK Cate and Deb wheel the catering cart away from the exhibi toward... EXT. LOADING DOCK — FLASHBACK Cate bangs on the back of a massive truck twice --

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Ready. From the driver’s window a small short haired woman peeks -. Ethel the dowager, who sold the first lot of jewels.

dialogues.speaker: ETHEL
dialogues.text: All set dear? Cate nods. Ethel honks the horn twice as she drives off. Cate still holds her yellow ball gown.  122. INT. CATE’S WAREHOUSE - PRESENT Debbie motions to all of them a job well done.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: And that’s how you all get: Sixteen Million, Five hundred and twenty nine thousand dollars. (smiles) A piece.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Right. We gotta sell ‘em. And Tammy here has recruited a few old friends to help us do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reuben sits in the audience, eating a pretzel with mustar

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN AUCTIONEER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: (in German) The collection is sold! To the gentlemen in front for thirty-eight million dollars. Reuben looks to the GERMAN BUYER, demonstrating the restrained joy of acquisition. Reuben wipes his mouth, ri walks out -- PRELAP: Gavel slamming.

dialogues.speaker: INT AUCTION HOUSE
dialogues.text: The Auctioneer stands before a group of bidders -- some v conference in, projected onto a wall, some bidders, representing in person, hold phones to their ears.

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: Sold -- to the gentlemen on the left... LINUS (Matt Damon) leans against the wall in the back of room, remaining inconspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basher emerges. He puts on his sunglasses.  123. SFX: The gavel slams. INT. SOTHEBY’S - MOSCOW - EVENING Another gavel. Saul Bloom pets a cat seated on his lap. Smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie stands at the entrance to the subway talking to Ta Tammy has that slightly spent quality of someone who has recently “been emotional.”

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: I’m in for the next one. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: And if you get back to New York Maybe we could...

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: This is better. We talked about it. “Little League.”

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: (nods) Yeah... I wrote you a letter, but every time I read it just sounded so lame so... (pulls something from her bag) Here. Tammy hands her a lucite replica of the Statue of Liberty from the 3D printer.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Thanks for this. She pats the black messenger back hanging from her should It obviously contains her cut.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Well. She goes to hug Tammy who tries to lean-in but Deb gives the cheek.  124.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb pushes through the turnstile and moved up to the trac waiting for the 1. She heads all the way down the platfor toward the far end waiting for the last car.

dialogues.speaker: IT ARRIVES
dialogues.text: Whizzing into the station with a blur. The train comes to rest and Deb moves through the last set of doors into the subway car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated in various positions around the car are the rest o her crew. Cate, Rose, Nine Ball, Constance, Amita. Each o them has a black canvas messenger bag. Deb sits near Cate None of them make eye contact. The train moves. A panhandler sings “Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds.” Everyone stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN SLOWS AGAIN
dialogues.text: Coming to a stop. Amita gets up to leave. Gives Deb a win

dialogues.speaker: DOORS SHUT. SUBWAY STARTS AGAIN., (TIME LAPSE)
dialogues.text: With each locked-off dissolve, another member of the team disappears -- There are now six, then five, then four, then finally...

dialogues.speaker: ROSE WEIL
dialogues.text: (Gushy/tears) I’m really going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Shh. Rose nods quickly. Remembers her cover. Exits the subway. They smile and...

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY ONLY DEBBIE AND CATE REMAIN
dialogues.text: Alone in the subway. They ride for a while in silence...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCEMENT
dialogues.text: 14th St. Transfer to the N, Q, R, 7 and § trains.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Okay then....  125.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Ok. Cate rises. Starts to cross past her.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on. Cate turns.

dialogues.speaker: LAS VEGAS STRIP
dialogues.text: In all its surrealistic glory. CAESAR’S PALACE POOL Cate and Debbie lie side by side on chaise lounges in a cabana.

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: That's incredibly stupid.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CATE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Deb smiles. Closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: But good, right? Cate closes her eyes as well.
